English Style Robust Porter with a West Coast twist, Carob and Maple are added into the Kettle.  Kent Golding Hops are added just to balance the Malt Sweetness.  Organic Pale, Munich, Chocolate, and Caramel malts comprise the Grain Bill. 

Aroma: Caramel (Burnt Sugar), Faint Hops
Tasting/Flavor: Combination of Carob and Coffee
Finish: Espresso and Hop Finish

beers.name: Golem
beers.description:
Wicked and Dangerously drinkable, this brew is made with Belgian pilsner malt, and small portions of wheat, oats, and corn, true Belgian candy sugar, and a variety of European Noble Hops including Saaz. No Fruit or Spices are used in this Brew! It’s all the Yeast’s Flavor Contributions.

Aroma: Bubblegum and Hops
Tasting/Flavor: Juicy, Spicy
Finish: Sugary Dryness

beers.name: Golem Belgian Strong Golden
beers.description: Belgian Strong Golden Ale. Wicked and Dangerously drinkable, this brew is made with Belgian pilsner malt, and small portions of wheat, oats, and corn, true Belgian candy sugar, and a variety of European Noble Hops including Saaz. No Fruit or Spices are used in this Brew! It’s all the Yeast’s Flavor Contributions.

beers.name: Iron Rail IPA
beers.description:
English Style India Pale Ale, Maris Otter 2-row, Canadian Honey Malt and Belgian Crystal.  Centennial, Kent Golding, and Cascade are added five times during the process, including Dry Hopping.

Aroma: Earthy, Citrusy, and Resinous
Tasting/Flavor: Orangy and Sugary Apricots
Finish: Malt Sweetness Balanced by Dry Hops

beers.name: Julian Price Pilsner
beers.description:
This is Beer-Beer! It’s what American Pilsner was originally meant to be. A perfect balance between european malts and noble european hops. Also, this brew is a lager, which means cooler fermentation temperatures, which allows the malt and hops to shine through. A single decoction is utilized for added maltiness.

Aroma: Spicy Noble Hops
Tasting/Flavor: Balanced with an Earthiness
Finish: Almost Champagne Like

beers.name: Payne's Pale Ale
beers.description:
American Style Pale Ale. Pale Malt and a portion of Rye malt and some very light crystal. Cascade hops are used in the brewing process with East Kent Golding hops after fermentation, also known as dry hopping.

Aroma: Clean and Hoppy
Tasting/Flavor: A Balance of Malt and Hops
Finish: Cereal Grains with a Touch of Bitterness

beers.name: Russian Imperial Stout
beers.description:
Originally created for the Russian royal family by English Brewers.  With the untraditional addition of 168 lbs. of raspberries, this brew is Intensely Decadent.

Aroma: Espresso/Dark Chocolate
Tasting/Flavor: Chocolate Mousse with Raspberry Layers
Finish: Tart Fruit with Burnt Undertones

beers.name: Apricot Seed Pale Ale
beers.description: An extremely smooth pale ale with apricot, and apricot seeds for a great aroma, without the sweetness

beers.name: Black Black Gose
beers.description: Ale brewed with sumac.

beers.name: Brewer's IPA
beers.description: Our new session ipa, brewed with Nelson Sauvin. Our tribute to all the brewers, and homebrewers, out there.

beers.name: Dark Chocolate Blueberry Porter
beers.description: A rich dark porter with dark chocolate, and hints of blueberry for a flavorful beer

beers.name: Dark Chocolate Sea Salt Stout
beers.description: A rich flavorful stout brewed with pink Himalayan sea salt. This beer has heavy roasted barley flavor with tones of coffee and chocolate.

beers.name: Imperial IPA
beers.description: A nice smooth citrus imperial IPA

beers.name: Orange Citrus IPA
beers.description: A nice, crisp and refreshing IPA with fresh orange peel add

beers.name: Peach Fig Pale Ale
beers.description: A smooth pale ale with a touch of peach added for aroma, and fig added for flavor

beers.name: Poplar Brown Ale
beers.description: A smooth easy to drink brown ale with a touch of honey from a poplar tree

beers.name: Doin' Thyme Witbier
beers.description: This innovative Belgian-style wheat ale is one of our Springtime favorites. Brewed with fresh thyme, coriander and lemon peel, Doin’ Thyme is slightly cloudy in appearance with a crisp, refreshing finish. Fills in perfectly as your first beer of the day or your first craft beer ever.

beers.name: Eat A Peach
beers.description: Eat A Peach is an American pale ale brewed with 450 pounds of fresh hand-picked Carolina peaches.You’ll notice a subtle, but super fresh peach flavor that compliments this mellow, well-balanced pale ale. A whole lotta love went into creating this end-of-summer treat.

beers.name: Fake Plastic Trees
beers.description: This tasty, hoppy wheat beer is bursting with citrus and lemongrass aromas, supported by a complementary malt backbone and a clean bitterness. A blend of Columbus, Cascade and Sorachi Ace hops bring the party to your mouth while the mellow wheat base quenches your thirst. Enjoy this delightfully distinctive ale at your cookout, your day at the lake or wherever your next adventure takes you.

beers.name: Fistful of Steel
beers.description: We used four different hops (Cascade, Amarillo, Chinook, and Simcoe) in this brew to give it a super dank hoppy flavor. You might pick up some piney characteristics and some toasty malt qualities that interact perfectly with the citrus undertones from the hops. You might say that Fistful of Steel is one of our hoppiest beers yet!

beers.name: Free Will Pale Ale
beers.description: This was our first beer! Easy to drink with a balance of malty goodness and hop love, this East-coast style pale ale makes a anytime, anywhere beer. Hopped with Columbus, Galena, Fuggle, and Willamette hops.

beers.name: Higher Ground IPA
beers.description:
Higher Ground is a classic West Coast IPA style, with a hearty dose of Cascade hops to create a delicious citrusy flavor and aroma.  We also include specialty crystal malts to give the beer it's unique caramel color and firm malt foundation.  It's noticeable bitterness is balanced by a subtle caramel background to make for an easy drinking IPA.
 
Tasting Notes: lemon, grapefruit, balanced malt and Cascade aroma

beers.name: Honey Pie
beers.description: It’s no secret that our Honey Pie Double IPA is often referred to as “Heaven in a glass.” In this limited release brew, a solid malt foundation is complimented by a generous amount of locally harvested honey, and you guessed it… HOPS! Our unique blend of hops will deliver aromas of honeydew and grapefruit, and will have you pouring the second beer before you’ve finished the first.

beers.name: Jalapeño Pale Ale
beers.description: Our Jalapeño Pale Ale is in a class of its own. We start by brewing our Free Will Pale Ale, and then add in a hefty dose of fresh-picked jalapeño peppers with the seeds removed, so you can enjoy a subtle flavor and the aroma of the green peppers without the heat.

beers.name: Lazy Bird Brown Ale
beers.description:
Named after a John Coltrane tune, Lazy Bird captures the essence of what it means to be an American Brown Ale.  It pours a mahogany brown with a noticeable lemony yet roasty aroma, which comes from a heavy amount of cascade hops at the end of the boil as well as a generous amount of roasted barley in the mash.  This combination of malt and hop intricacy makes for an enjoyable beer year round.

Tasting Notes: lemony yet roasty aroma, subtle Cascadian hop bitterness

beers.name: MexiCali Stout
beers.description: A strong coffee and cinnamon aroma complements a smooth chocolate taste with just a hint of chili spice. We used local coffee and fresh spices to create this unique blend. The MexiCali stout balances both sweet and spicy elements for a delightful taste that will have you ordering another pint before you've even finished the first.

beers.name: Pink Robots
beers.description: Brewed with 100+ lbs of fresh raspberries & blackberries.

beers.name: Raise a Ruckus
beers.description: Raise a Ruckus (Dark Rye Ale): A somewhat different fall seasonal that blends NC rye malt with raisiny caramel sweetness into an unusual dark ale. It has pleasant raisin and fig aromatics upfront with a slight hint of rye spiciness. On the palate, it comes through with medium body and rich dark caramel flavor. A perfect beer for cool Autumn days.

beers.name: Red House Wheat
beers.description: The Red House Wheat is a delicious American-style wheat beer with delicate cherry and plum flavors. With a dry finish and subtle fruit characteristics, Red House will be your new favorite beer. It's light at 4.3 % ABV and wonderfully refreshing.

beers.name: The Pride
beers.description: The Pride is designed to keep you warm on those colder months of the year. It starts with warm aromas of cherry and fig. The Belgian yeast, specialty malts, and alcohol work together to give the beer warming cherry, dark caramel, and bready notes. A great beer to enjoy amongst great people.

beers.name: To The Bitter End
beers.description: A true session ale, the English-style bitter is really meant to be had while standing around.  It has a nice apple and toffee aroma and a pleasant balanced bitterness and slight sweetness.  Perfect for patio drinking!

beers.name: Up on the Sun
beers.description: Inspired by the farmhouse traditions of Belgium and France, our big bold saison is surprisingly light and approachable. We give the yeast full reign to work its magic in this beer. You’ll pick up on pepper, stone fruit and floral notes. Up on the Sun is your first sip of the astronomical Spring. Continue the tradition!

beers.name: Wake Up Porter
beers.description: Our Wake Up Porter is an irresistibly smooth brew with locally roasted coffee and fresh vanilla beans. We use Central Coffee Co.’s Sumatra Lintong coffee and carefully chosen specialty malts to create a warm foundation and light body. Madagascar vanilla beans lend a subtle sweetness on the finish that you’ll notice at the end of every velvety sip.

beers.name: Abund N.C. IPA
beers.description: Big notes of tropical fruit burst open in the aroma from the 7 C's hops while Chinook hops contribute bitterness and a slight piney flavor in our double IPA.  Five different malts give the beer a complex and chewy mouthfeel.

beers.name: Batch #1 English IPA
beers.description: This ale could be considered to be on steroids, but it is a drinkable quaff. Subtle citrus tones with a nice little spicy hop tone to back it up. Citrus in the aroma and the spice on the back end followed with a sharp bitterness.

beers.name: Bombshell Dunkelweizen
beers.description: You’ll swear that this sweetheart of beer is straight from across the big pond. Roll out the barrel and have a barrel of fun! Hefeweizen fans you NEED to see how good the dark side can be! The banana esters with a slight suggestion of cloves will delight your senses. Dark and bisque malt will make this a tasting and sensory experience not to forget!

beers.name: Bombshell Perception Pale Ale
beers.description: American pale ales are still new in the big scheme of beer styles and here is our perception of what an amazing American pale ale should be! A citrusy head, pine notes in the body and well balanced malt notes throughout.

beers.name: Dirty Secret Coconut Stout
beers.description: Brewed with copious amounts of all natural, hand-toasted coconut that gives a pleasing nose and delicious flavor. Specialty malts provide rich chocolate notes that create a perfect balance to the subtle sweetness of the coconut.

beers.name: Dirty Secret Russian Imperial Stout
beers.description: This big stout can please even the most notorious of rulers. Conditioning on French chocolate oak and vanilla bourbon beans produces big notes of chocolate intertwined with subtle undertones of vanilla and bourbon.

beers.name: Dirty Secret Stout  - Dry Irish Batch
beers.description: With this stout you will taste Carafa 2, Chocolate malt, and Black malt right out the gate. You will notice it is smooth with a light hoppy bitterness. It will finish like one of your favorite stouts. We kept this one simple and straight to the point.

beers.name: Dirty Secret Stout - Coconut Bash
beers.description: This batch, which will be available in a nitrogenated and carbonated version, has subtle chocolate notes on the front and a hint of sweet coconut on the back, a slight roasted barley bitterness creates the perfect balance.

beers.name: Dirty Secret Stout - Oatmeal Batch
beers.description: Our well balanced stout presents with chocolate notes on the front and the perfect amount of sweet creaminess on the finish.

beers.name: Figgy Elder Brown Ale
beers.description: Our brown ale offers a subtle aroma of juicy, sun-ripened figs. Subtle notes of chocolate and a hint of  malty sweetness can be found in the body. Elderberries produce a delicate tartness in the finish.

beers.name: Hey! Honey! Hefeweizen!
beers.description: This crisp and champagne like beer will be certain to please those looking for an easy drinking style. Tones of bubble gum, banana and clove are present from the Weihenstephan yeast. Sweet orange peel provides the citrusy notes.

beers.name: JEMS Jade Pale Ale
beers.description: This pale ale is single hop infused with Pacific Jade hops. You will notice the fruitiness coming from the Chico yeast supplied by Brewing Institute of America.The JEMS brewed this one to get feedback from our consumers on thoughts of our flagship pale ale.

beers.name: Lemongrass Pale Ale
beers.description: Just because it says lemon doesn't mean you have to pucker up.  Of course, you might enjoy the soft kiss of citrus and light hops this refreshing and approachable ale delivers. Grab one and hang out or take a growler home to your special someone.

beers.name: Lost My Way IPA
beers.description:
Have you been seeking a quaffable IPA to no avail? Have you wondered aimlessly searching for a session IPA with the perfect balanced notes of pine and subtle citrus? Well you have found your way my friend.

If you are thinking "I've lost my way" in the quest for an IPA that is neither too bold nor too assertive, its time to set your sensory GPS for a new destination.  Let Bombshell Beer Company put you on the right path.  This copper colored beauty is a wonderful balance of pine and subtle citrus-stronger than our pale ales but gentler than some ofthe over-the top monsters that are out there. Sometimes you just have to stop and ask for directions!

beers.name: Pickup Line Porter
beers.description: This well balanced porter is smooth and has light notes of chocolaty and roasted tones. Only two hops went into this brew Zythos and Tettnang. Zythos were added for the bitterness and Tettnang's to balance out the chocolate malt.

beers.name: Polished Pilsener
beers.description: For PBR hipsters and NON Hop Heads here's one for you! A light crisp pilsener that is sure to please any domestic beer drinker. We aimed for a traditional German pilsener with a low ABV and low IBU's.

beers.name: Kernel Husky Wheat
beers.description: A refreshing wheat beer that favors hoppy notes over yeast character.

beers.name: Nutty Brunette
beers.description: "Nutty" refers to the toasted biscuity, light, sweet (toffee) malt aromas. An appealing light fresh hop aroma is noticed, and has a dark amber, translucent color with a light tan head. The Head Brewmaster named this one after his wife, but she doesn't get it.

beers.name: Salamander Slam IPA
beers.description: Hop flavors are moderately high and floral to citrusy. The malts add complexity and give the beer a pleasant flavor, a golden color, and support the hop aspect. So, take a hike! If you love the smell of the woods after a fall rain, let our English India Pale Ale (IPA) take you there. The only thing missing are the bugs!

beers.name: #NOHOLDSIE Holdsie Da Deuce
beers.description: Rye Tripel aged in red Wine Barrels

beers.name: #NOHOLDSIE Holdsie San
beers.description: Rye Tripel aged in Bourbon Barrels

beers.name: #‎NOHOLDSIE‬ Holdsie Uno
beers.description: Rye Tripel aged in White Wine Barrels

beers.name: Belgian Chocolate Stout
beers.description: Belgian Chocolate. Blood orange zest. Fruity Belgian yeast. Flaked rye. A smooth, tan head and a thick, creamy mouthfeel.

beers.name: Belgian Pale Ale
beers.description: Tasty hops in a Belgian? Oh yeah. A perfect balance of traditional noble hops and a host of punchy American hops sets our Belgian Pale Ale up to provide you with a clean, sessionable brew for a toasty summer day.

beers.name: Beneath The Feet Of Orion
beers.description: "Beneath the Feet of Orion, our Imperial Rye Saison, is brewed with fresh East Branch baby ginger root, a little toasted cumin seed and over 200 pounds of fresh red core carrots from Bushy Tail Farm, right here in Saxapahaw! Each of the ingredients melds wonderfully with one another and works in concert with the grain and yeast notes to offer up a bright, clean, dry farmhouse ale that we're really excited to release in 750ml bottles for the first time!"

beers.name: Brah'klava
beers.description: Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Bluejacket in DC and Starpoint in Carborro to celebrate Beer Study’s third birthday, this baklava-inspired Belgian Golden Strong was brewed with a sizable portion of honey malt, 300 pounds of roasted pistachios, green cardamom, ceylon cinnamon and a touch of rose water, then aged in bourbon barrels for over six months.

beers.name: Carolina Peach Witbier
beers.description: Currently under development, our classic summer ale is fermented on top of North Carolina peaches for a bright, crispy, refreshing classic Belgian wheat beer.

beers.name: Cotton Pickin' Farmhouse IPA
beers.description: We take a Belgian-style base ale and essentially double the malt and hops, then age it on Brettanomyces and wrap it up with big Citra and Amarillo hops to provide 85IBUs and 8.2%abv of one great tasting Farmhouse India Pale Ale.

beers.name: Dust Bunny Barrel Aged Wild Ale
beers.description: A barrel-aged saison fermented with eight different strains of brettanomyces

beers.name: House Saison
beers.description: Brewed with North Carolina sourwood honey, organic pilsner malt and hops and dry as a bone, this golden Saison is as beautiful as it is easy to drink.

beers.name: Memorial Day 2012 Wild Ale
beers.description: The brandy/red wine barrel fermented saison we brewed with Mystery Brewing Company, for which each half was fermented with our respective wild house yeasts and blended at packaging.

beers.name: Newlin's Original Oatmeal Pale
beers.description: A fruity, moderately malty, somewhat spicy, easy-drinking, copper-colored ale.

beers.name: Regent's Rye Tripel
beers.description: Our take on the traditional Trappist Tripel-style ale, brewed with 100% NC-grown barley from Riverbend Malthouse in Asheville and authentic Belgian candi syrup. Crisp, bright and refreshingly dry, this Tripel takes advantage of a malted rye addition to provide a subtle spicy foundation for the yeast esters.

beers.name: St. Benedict's Breakfast Dubbel
beers.description: Brewed with organic flaked oats, dark chocolate and locally-roasted Sumatran and Ethiopian Harar coffee beans from Morrisville, NC's Muddy Dog Roasting Company, our Trappist-style "Breakfast" Dubbel is a smooth, silky, eye-opening take on a classic style, with floral aromatics of deep-roasted coffee, spiced fig and rich, creamy cocoa.

beers.name: Wild Black Saison
beers.description: With just a hint of hibiscus, our Wild Black Saison is as dark as midnight on the Haw River. And it's a little wild too; we finish this one with Brettanomyces, a wild yeast that provides a crisp, funky tang and a nice, dry finish.

beers.name: Burn Down
beers.description: Pale, crystal, and chocolate sweet malts intermingle with tasty rolled, slightly smoked oats to deliver a delicious and mildly creamy brown ale.

beers.name: Burn Down For WHAT
beers.description: Unboiled and unhopped wort is transformed into this complex sour ale through the use of our in house Kombucha culture.  Half barrel aged, half in steel, and just a touch of fresh Burn Down Brown blend together to bring you this

beers.name: Citraphilia
beers.description: All citra hop IPA with lemon peel

beers.name: Johnny Rico Red IPA
beers.description:
"These are the rules. Everybody fights, nobody quits. If you don't do your job I'll kill you myself. Welcome to the Roughnecks!"
-Johnny Rico
Red IPA Brewed with citrus peel, dry hopped with cascade and citra.

beers.name: Tart De La Wit
beers.description: Strawberry Wild Ale

beers.name: The Magellan
beers.description: We take our Burn Down Brown and give it a dose of what explorer Ferdinand Magellan had in mind when he set sail for the Spice Islands.  Cinnamon, nutmeg, clove and ginger blend seamlessly with organic maple extract to provide a wonderful spiced ale.

beers.name: The Mirage
beers.description: This classic Belgian Tripel showcases the fine pilsner malt and belgian yeast we use. The two play together to bring you a soft malt character, with complex ester notes, and slight alcohol aroma.  High carbonation helps this beer remain light despite its high alcohol content.

beers.name: Beaver Brown Ale
beers.description: Our Beaver Brown Ale is a dark brown beer, slightly sweet with a hint of Chocolate. Dam Good Beer! Enjoy one now!

beers.name: Bohemian Pilsner
beers.description: Our Bohemian Pilsner is made from floor malted Bohemian Barley and Saaz Hops from the Czech Republic. This beer is very light in color with good hop flavor. To give this beer a truly old world style, this beer is unfiltered.

beers.name: Kellerbier
beers.description: Our kellebier is deep orange in color and has been lagered for 8 weeks. Very similar to our Marzenfestbier but with more body and a deeper color

beers.name: Porter
beers.description: Our Porter is rich, robust and sweet with a nice hint of Chocolate.

beers.name: Possum Pale Ale
beers.description: Possum Pale Ale is an American Pale Ale that has great hop taste and aroma. Grab a Possum Today!

beers.name: Raccoon Red Ale
beers.description: Raccoon Red is a dark red ale, with a great malty taste. Grab a Raccoon Today.

beers.name: Whitetail Wheat
beers.description: Our Whitetail Wheat is a German HeffeWeizen Style Beer with notes of Banana and Clove.

beers.name: Adamanthea: Adelaide Sparkling Ale
beers.description: Our version of this Australian take on British Ordinary Bitter, with a light, malty body, and the bright, citrusy finish of Pacific Jade hops.

beers.name: Ballantrae
beers.description: A light, sweet, traditional light Scottish ale, made with floor-malted British malt, a titch of Caramel malt, a touch of roasted barley, and the barest wisp of smoked malt along with traditional British hops, and Scottish ale yeast. An easy-drinking light dark beer for winter that pairs excellently with shortbread, mild sausage, and woody cheddars.

beers.name: Beatrix: Spring Saison
beers.description: A hoppy, floral saison made for spring with crisp bitterness and dry complexity made with unmalted wheat, Demerera sugar, and a new breeed of hops called Delta - a mix between traditional English Fuggles and American Cascade hops.

beers.name: Birthday Cake
beers.description:
This beer came to me as an inspiration one night while I was driving home one night thinking about our upcoming birthday celebration, the need for a novella release in front of it, and the spare ingredients we had sitting in the brewery - namely leftover lemongrass.
 
It's not the type of beer that I usually make, but altogether I'm very happy that it came out to taste, well, just like lemon sponge cake with sugary sweet frosting.  It's very Funfetti.
 
The choice of ingredients here are really to support the whole idea:  lactose as an unfermentable sugar to lend sweetness, Tahoma hops because they have a lemony hop character, and Acidulated Malt to give that light extra tang to make the Lemongrass more complex and a little less Pledge-y.  The vanilla was dosed to taste at 100ml and then scaled up to the whole batch.

beers.name: Buchanan
beers.description: Made with acorn squash, butternut squash, sweet potatoes, and a smattering of lovely spices.

beers.name: Caswell
beers.description: Built from recipes found in historical documents during research for the book North Carolina Craft Beer and Breweries. This dry beer contains molasses, ginger, wheat, rice, and North Carolina grown barley.

beers.name: Dragon's Mouth
beers.description: Aged on tobago peppers.

beers.name: Evangeline: Saison
beers.description: A dry farmhouse ale. The primary character of this beer is from yeast: apple and pear flavors blend with spicy phenolics, classic Belgian yeast bubblegum flavors and the unmistakable pepperiness of rye for a truly refreshing summer beer.

beers.name: Fantine: Red Belgian IPA
beers.description: This copper-colored beer is a blend of three different styles: Roasted Barley and Carmel Munich malt give it its color and light biscuity, malty body, bitterness are derived from German and French hops, and its bright citrusy bite is provided by a generous dosing of Summit hops. Fermented with Belgian Abbey yeast.

beers.name: Fruits Of Our Labors
beers.description: Pineapple Cilantro Saison

beers.name: Gentlemen's Preference: Blond Ale
beers.description: A light, easy drinking blonde ale with a touch of sweetness and a touch of hops. Our version is made with Trappist Ale Yeast for an extra little bit of dryness and fruity aroma that makes for a truly refreshing blonde ale.

beers.name: King Of Ashton
beers.description: Golden Ale with Rhythm and Blues

beers.name: Langhorne: Rye Wit
beers.description: This beer is a Belgian-style wit or "white" beer. These beers are traditionally made with wheat malt, coriander, and curacao orange peel. Our version uses rye instead of wheat and relies on the spiciness of rye to take the place of the coriander. We use a spice blend to finish that includes blood orange peel, hibiscus flowers, and rose hips.

beers.name: Lockwood's Retreat: India Pale Ale
beers.description: This IPA is an East Coast version of a West Coast IPA. A sweet, malty, caramel backbone and the big citrus splash of C-hops, but without lingering bitterness. A big, beautiful, drinkable IPA.

beers.name: Mousqueton: Belgian-Style Tripel
beers.description: A big, bold, Belgian-style Tripel - lots of warm, rich malt flavors infused with the distinctive flavor of Belgian Abbey Ale yeast.

beers.name: Pickwick Mild Ale
beers.description: A traditional English Mild Ale based on a recipe from the 1880s. Light malt, hints of caramel and toffee, a touch of earthy British hops, and a nutty flavor make this session beer quaffable and delicious.

beers.name: Queen Anne's Revenge: Carolinian Dark
beers.description: This beer was designed to be a darker version of an English-style IPA, to show off the soft bitterness of traditional English hops but to balance them with the rich chocolate of roasted malt. The name “Carolinian Dark” is a dig at “Cascadian Dark” ales which seem to somehow suggest that either the PNW has the only available line on hops, or perhaps that it’s made by elves.

beers.name: Rosalind
beers.description: A drier, hoppier version of our summer saison Evangeline. Apple, pear, and pineapple flavors from our yeast strain harmonize with the floral character of European hops for a refreshing fall saison as crisp as an autumn evening.

beers.name: Six Impossible Things: Chocolate Breakfast Stout
beers.description: A rich, buttery oatmeal stout with undercurrents of cocoa and coffee. The grain additions in this beer are designed to impart chocolate, toffee, and caramel notes without overt bitterness, creating a smooth, drinkable stout. Aged on Dominican cocoa nibs; locally roasted cold-brewed coffee added in the cask.

beers.name: St. Stephen's Green: Dry Irish Stout
beers.description: A classic Dry Irish Stout — dry, roasty, and refreshing, with notes of bitter chocolate and espresso supported by a light sour tang and a light play of British hops.

beers.name: Trouble Wit Tribbles
beers.description: This Triticale Witbier is bready, citrusy, and spicy! It's made with NC Triticale from Epiphany Malting and NC wheat from Riverbend, so it's all kinds of local!

beers.name: Waggledance: Farmhouse Ale
beers.description: Brewed in conjunction with Market in Raleigh, this beer is made with locally grown barley, locally harvested lemon balm, and local honey for a unique farm-to-glass beer. Light and spritzy with notes of lemon and a late palate full of complex floral honey; it is incredibly dry and goes perfectly with a summer afternoon or a rich, delicious dinner.

beers.name: 'tis the Saison
beers.description: A Saison brewed with rye malt and three types of peppercorn.  This is Bart’s first NoDable Series brew so come out and enjoy!

beers.name: 10 Blocks South
beers.description: Tired of the standard American Pale Ale? Not feeling the hop bite and higher ABV of an IPA? We have something in-between. What you get is a hop-centric but easy drinking beer with tons of citrus and floral hop character brought on by Centennial, Cascade, Columbus and Chinook hops and backed with a solid malt bill.

beers.name: Aprinox
beers.description: Apricot IPA

beers.name: Autopilot
beers.description: This is somewhat of a summer “lawnmower” ale.  It’s easy drinking and refreshing but to make it NoDable, we hopped it heavily in the late part of the boil and dry hopped with lots of Amarillo and Santiam hops.  This gives a huge grapefruit & orange-like aroma and initial taste without overly bitter finish.

beers.name: Barn Hopper
beers.description: A fusion of an American IPA & a Saison blends American & Belgian malt with a heavy hop load of American Centennials and notes of Tettanger, a spicy German hop used sometimes in Saisons.  We’ve spiced it lightly with seeds of paradise and bitter orange peel to give it the citrus character of an IPA while still being spiced like a Saison.

beers.name: Belgian Baster
beers.description: Our 5th NoDable Series release is Belgian Baster, a Belgian Dubbel.  This Belgian dark hued ale with lots of malty and Belgian yeast character accented for the recent holiday with fresh cranberries & cinnamon giving it a unique spice that you’d never expect from a Belgian style ale.  Feels like Thanksgiving all over again.

beers.name: Boiler Hater
beers.description: This week Chad gives us an experimental Pale Ale he’s made called Boiler Hater. No hops were added during the boil on this one, only mash hop and dry hop additions. Coming in at 5.8% ABV and 48 IBUs it’ll be a refreshing way to get out of this BOILING heat.

beers.name: Burn Out
beers.description: Double India Brown Ale.  To celebrate Charlotte Craft Beer Week, we have collaborated on a beer with Mac’s Speed Shop.  Both Mac’s & the tap room will debut Burnout at 4:00 pm.  In the tap room, once the keg is finished, we will infuse Midnight Madness with whole leaf Centennial & Amarillo hops.

beers.name: Calyptic Blonde Ale
beers.description: A Belgian blonde ale using Calypso hops to give it a nice, apple character on top of the natural esters from the yeast used.

beers.name: CaraRyeZer
beers.description: Rye Pale Ale

beers.name: CAVU
beers.description: CAVU is a flight term used to describe ideal conditions. We hope you have the same outlook while sipping on this light-colored ales that presents itself with hints of tropical fruit and citrus from our west coast hops, then finished clean and bright.... like a cool breeze on a clear summer day.

beers.name: CHAllie Brown
beers.description: CHAIlie Brown is our 7th beer in the NoDable Series.  Spiced with organic vanilla beans, fennel seeds, coriander, cloves, cinnamon sticks, black pepper and whole nutmeg for a modest chai spice in a slightly sweet, low hopped English Brown ale.

beers.name: Coco Loco
beers.description: Chocolate and Brown malts contribute a stunningly deep rich color with ruby highlights in this Robust Porter. The slight bitterness from American chocolate is balanced with the sweet roastiness of toasted organic coconut. A great beer before, during, or after a meal!

beers.name: Dark Thymes
beers.description: A Black Saison with spices that include Thyme, Seeds of Paradise and Coriander.

beers.name: Dirty Monkey
beers.description: Dirty Monkey is a chocolate infused Dunkelweisse. Dunkelweisse’s are basically dark hefeweisses but this one takes it up a notch. We add chocolate malt as well as roasted coco nibs to enhance the sweeter dark malt character and then ferment the beer hot so that the banana and clove notes from the German wheat beer yeast comes out strong.

beers.name: Draft Monk
beers.description: Like many before it, this week's NoDable is inspired by the current weather. "Draft Monk' is a Belgian Pale Ale brewed with Belgian Abbey yeast and caramel malt. The Belgian yeast gives this beer banana, pear, and apple notes, while the caramel malt gives it the golden color. Enjoy!

beers.name: Dubbel Trouble
beers.description: This week's #NoDable is 'Dubbel Trouble', a Belgian Dubbel. Belgian Dubbels are strong ales, but not as intense as a Belgian Quad. They typically have dark fruit character, and we decided to enhance that by fermenting this tasty brew on cherries and plums. It's 7.4% ABV and 100% delicious! Come by the tap room December 6th to give it a taste. Cheers!

beers.name: Dynamic Duo
beers.description: This week's NoDable features a tasty twosome... a pleasing pair... a Dynamic Duo! Mosiac and Loral hops are the stars of this Imperial IPA. Loral hops are a brand new variety that have notes of pine and lemongrass, with hints of stonefruit. Mosaic hops balance the Loral perfectly with their tropical and fruity character. Cheers!

beers.name: Epiphany Pale Ale
beers.description: Brewed using the first batch of a local North Carolina malt, Epiphany. Bittered with Magnum. Cascade and CTZ hops added at the end of the boil and used for dry-hopping.

beers.name: Extra Special Bart
beers.description: Traditional English ESB (extra special bitter)

beers.name: Funkaversary
beers.description: It's hard to imagine the Charlotte Craft Beer Scene without one of it's longest and earliest supporters, a happy monkish lookin' guy somewhere on Park Road.  This year marks that mysterious man's 10 year anniversary.  To celebrate this anniversary, New Belgium Brewing Company (Fort Collons, CO) and NoDa Brewing Company (Charlotte, NC) have collaborated to bring you a unique brew from both breweries... the Funkaversary Belgian style sour ale.  NoDa Brewing Company has contributed their Seasonal Belgian Pale Ale, Monk's Trunks, some of which has aged for over 9 months in Chardonnay Barrels.  We blended the Monk's Trunks together with New Belgiums' blonde base sour ale, Felix.  The resulting complex mix of beers from different styles and from both new and well established breweries is a tribute to this fellow's support of all types of craft beer.  Cheers, and heres' to many years to come

beers.name: Get The Party Tarted
beers.description: Inspired by a Berliner Weisse…we call it a “NorthCarolinerWeisse”.  It’s infused with Bing cherries and raspberries, a delicious way to escape the summer heat. Come in, grab a glass and join the party!

beers.name: Ghost Hop
beers.description:
Don’t be scared, it’s only Ghost Hop. This spookily pale IPA (white IPA) technically doesn’t exist in style guidelines.  It is the contrast to the now commonly seen Dark/Black IPAs or Cascadian Dark Ales.  

The beer is a unique contrast from the standard IPA recipe.  It is hopped like a normal IPA and has a standard IPA malt bill MINUS any dark caramelized or crystal malts.  A heavy amount of White Wheat adds body & head retention and the lack of the darker caramel malts leave this beer as pale as a Belgian Wit, which is the other twist… This beer is fermented on Belgian Wit yeast as opposed to the typical Californian yeast you would find in most IPAs.

beers.name: Gordgeous
beers.description: Open up a can of autumn with this delicious pumpkin ale. Made with real pumpkin  puree in every batch, paired with brown sugar, ginger root and hand-cracked spices including allspice, cloves, and cardamom.  Gordgeous container no cinnamon or nutmeg, Because it's different that other pumpkin ales. Add that's a beautiful thing.

beers.name: Grapefruit Geddy
beers.description: This week’s NoDable was inspired by the 2016 AIGA Beer & Branding contest winner, Thad Mitchell. After winning, Thad was able to come to our original location to brew his IPA, Grapefruit Geddy. This is a New England style IPA infused with grapefruit. As you could guess, it is very hazy! It was brewed with London Ale III yeast and Amarillo, Centennial, and Citra hops. Come by the tap room to taste this 6.5% ABV masterpiece. Cheers!

beers.name: Hart en Ziel
beers.description: Our Belgian Strong Ale that is hopped like an American IPA.  This is our assistant brewer Matt’s first NoDable Series release and the name is appropriate.  Hart en Ziel is Dutch for Heart & Soul.

beers.name: HefeRyezen
beers.description: A Hefeweizen made with wheat, pilsner, and rye malt and hopped with Magnum and Hallertauer Mittelfrueh hops.

beers.name: Hop Cakes
beers.description: Hop Cakes, a maple syrup infused double IPA.  Only base grain used in the mash so ALL the color and sweetness is given from the maple syrup instead of specialty malts.

beers.name: Hop Roggen
beers.description: This week’s NoDable beer is called ‘Hop Roggen’. Roggen is german for rye, and this brew has a 50% rye malt bill. This beer is brewed with Citra and Centennial hops and has a dry and spicy character that rye normally brings to a brew.

beers.name: Hop, Drop 'n Roll
beers.description: For us this is where it all started! The rich golden color comes from a blend of English and American base malts accented with substantial amounts of Victory and Wheat malt. The American citrus hops take center stage with emphasis on late boil additions of Citra and Amarillo. This signature ale is hopped before, during, and after the boil!

beers.name: Hopslager
beers.description: a dry-hopped lager

beers.name: Hot Pistol
beers.description: This Milk Stout takes on the flavors its ingredients which include raspberries, habanero, and milk chocolate.

beers.name: Imperial CoCo LoCo
beers.description: Brewed with Cocao nibs and toasted organic Coconut.

beers.name: Jam Session
beers.description: The evolution of American Pale Ale—still a session beer but it sacrifices nothing—clear hop flavor shines through without being too dominant, and there’s a great malt flavor uncommon to the variety. The backbone of this beer is the balance of imported Maris Otter and Caramunich malts with the pine and citrus flavors of Centennial, Simcoe, and Citra hops.

beers.name: Jole Mole
beers.description: Last NoDable Series release of 2011!  Jole Mole is our Mexican-inspired American Amber Ale which is lightly hopped with Challenger & East Kent Goldings, flavored with Mexican cocoa powder and New Mexico & chipotle chili peppers.  The chipotle chilies add a smokiness to the pepper warmth.  This beer is not for the faint of heart!

beers.name: Kinda Peachy
beers.description: This week’s NoDable is a peach Kettle Sour! The wort was left in the kettle at a warm temperature for about 48 hours to give it that bright, tart flavor that you expect in a sour. It was then refermented on peach puree to create a, you know, peachy taste.

beers.name: KiWit
beers.description: Kiwi Belgian Witbier

beers.name: Liquid Lust
beers.description: Russian Imperial Raspberry Stout

beers.name: Mexi Lager
beers.description: Super clean and refreshing lager for hot summer days. Brewed with flaked corn and fermented with Mexican lager yeast.

beers.name: Midnight Madness
beers.description: Cascadian Dark Ale.  This is our version of a Cascadian Dark Ale, more commonly known as a Black IPA. Made with seven hop varieties: Cascade, Crystal, Centennial, Columbus (Tomahawk), Chinook, Amarillo Gold and Simcoe.

beers.name: Monk's Trunks
beers.description: This Belgian pale ale utilizes traditional Belgian malts and European hops. Belgian yeast brings flavors of apple, banana, vanilla and grapes naturally through its fermentation and accented with seeds of paradise. This blend is an intriguing palate pleaser.

beers.name: Montro
beers.description: This Imperial Stout is brewed with coco nibs and molasses; these ingredients provide the beer with a rich, dark, and complex character.

beers.name: Morning NoDaVation
beers.description: Are you ready for some Morning NoDaVation?  The 4th beer in our NoDable Series is a breakfast stout worth waking up for.  An easy drinking stout with dark malts and chocolaty character infused with Costa Rican and Sumatran coffee blends cold pressed for us right down the road at Smelly Cat.  Adding to the mouth-feel and backbone of the flavor is a heaping portion of oatmeal.

beers.name: N.E. Day Pale Ale
beers.description: This American Pale ale has wheat and Epiphany malt and was brewed with Cascade and CTZ hops. It was hopped before the fermentation process was finished, giving it a stronger citrus flavor. Fermented on New England Style yeast, N.E. Day has the flavor and look of a New England IPA, but it is lighter and has a lower ABV. Cheers!

beers.name: Natural Blond
beers.description: Belgian Blond Ales are slightly stronger than Belgian pale ales, closer to the ABV of a Belgian Dubbel, but with the same rich and bright character of the Belgian Pale Ale.  We used Belgian abbey yeast to give it a rich fruit forward yeast character.

beers.name: Naughty List
beers.description: For the holiday week, we offer up our Naughty List.  Every year Santa plagues the poor naughty people of the world with coal in their stockings. This is a problem that we at NoDa have decided to fix. We give you Naughty List, a succulent winter warmer with bourbon soaked vanilla beans, aged on dark rum infused oak chips offering that even Santa himself can’t cart away from you.

beers.name: NoDajito
beers.description: Our Mojito inspired Belgian Wit infused with mint leaves and lime zest.

beers.name: NoDaRyeZ'd
beers.description: Double Rye India Pale Ale.  A solid malt backbone with a hefty amount of Rye, to further the grain bill, plus a 7 hop blend gives this beer an “American” IPA flavor and aroma but also accentuate the spiciness of the Rye.

beers.name: Oktoberfest
beers.description: This week, we are celebrating German Oktoberfest with our own fall brew! Our Oktoberfest beer is 6.3% ABV and has 20 IBUs. This full-bodied beer is brewed with German Bach yeast, German malts including Vienna, Munich, and Pilsner, and, you guessed it, all German hops. The malty-sweet taste is balanced by the crisp, dry finish. Come by the tap room and give it a taste! Prost!

beers.name: Old Voyage
beers.description: This British-Style Barley Wine Ale is a throwback to English brewing customs as we use all English grain, hops and yeast.

beers.name: Pacific Reign
beers.description: It's hard to imagine a more iconic American ale than the Imperial IPA. Bold and full flavored, this beer embodies the aggressive brewing practices that the US craft brewers have been known for. Here at NoDa Brewing, there's hops in our logo so you know we've been wanting to brew up an Imperial IPA since the beginning. Bold Pacific Northwestern hops combine with New Zealand hop varieties to give us a full Pacific hop assault in the form of Nelson Sauvin, Pacific Jade, Centennial, Columbus, Warrior, and Amarillo.  We then fortify the beer with delicious local Orange Blossom Honey. Don't worry... it won't attract bears, just new friends eager to share a bottle with you!

beers.name: Premium Roast Coffee Stout
beers.description: Premium Roast is a dark, rich, and roasty coffee stout offering. This 5% American Stout is quite drinkable and has its natural roasty character accented by the addition of our own custom coffee blend from Charlotte's own Parliament Coffee Roasters. The coffee blend consists of 50% Ethiopian beans and 50% Columbian beans. While the Columbian variety offers a rich, full bodied coffee note, the Ethiopian beans accent the coffee character with bright berry notes. We added a total of 70 lbs of this blend to the beer and are more than happy with how the full coffee flavor fills out the roasty, thick stout.

beers.name: Ramble on Red
beers.description: A red ale with character, Ramble On Red uses the unique combination of rye malt and Belgian Special B with Challenger hops. While it has more body than most reds and a malt-forward profile, it is still a session beer of the finest variety.

beers.name: Red Summit
beers.description: Prepare for Red Summit, a dark Amber American IPA using a slew of specialty malts to give a darker, bolder malt character to balance the full on assault of hops armed to the teeth with the most intense weapon in the hop arsenal, SUMMIT hops!  This baby is packed with Summit, Centennial, Summit, Warrior, Summit, Cascade, and oh did I mention Summit.

beers.name: Rye Not Stout
beers.description: Rye Not Stout is an Amercian Stout with Rye malt and Chocolate Rye malt.  Why two types of rye? Rye Not?!

beers.name: Rye So Serious???
beers.description: Belgian Strong Dark Ale with Rye. Belgian beers have a long history, so why not screw it up with some American Rye Malt? This strong dark beer boast heavy raisin notes from the special b malts as well as a large fruity ester character form the yeast with undertones of spicy rye.

beers.name: Ryet Spice Belgian Wit
beers.description: Our Belgian Wit substitutes the flaked oats with flaked rye and adds lavender, thyme & coriander to the mix.

beers.name: S'more Porter
beers.description: S’more Porter is exactly what it sounds like.  A graham cracker milk porter with chocolate, cinnamon and vanilla.  Heavy amounts of biscuit malt accompanying ACTUAL graham crackers in the mash give this porter a bready sweetness and bits of Hersey Dark Chocolate & Lactose add the signature chocolate notes and thickness of freshly roasted marshmallows.  Add a little bit of smoke malt to for that “by the campfire” feel and finish with vanilla and you have yourself one tasty NoDable brew!

beers.name: S.S.A.S.M.A.S.H.
beers.description: Single Spice And Single Malt And Single Hop Ale.

beers.name: Saison De Maison
beers.description: A refreshing French Saison, highlighted by rye, oats, and Hallertauer Mandarina hops. This beer finishes very dry, but still has a silky mouthfeel.

beers.name: Satsuma IPA
beers.description: This week's NoDable is an IPA brewed with Satsuma Oranges and American Citrus hops. Cheers!

beers.name: Single Berry
beers.description: American Wheat Ale with fresh picked blackberries.

beers.name: Special Bee
beers.description: Belgian Red Ale.  What can we say other than… it’s special.

beers.name: Steam Punk
beers.description: This week's NoDable is a delicious California Common beer. A California Common, also known as a steam beer, is a lager whose yeast is fermented at higher temperatures.This 'Steam Punk' was brewed with Northern Brewer Hops and Epiphany and Munich malts. Come to the tap room to taste this balanced, 5.3% ABV and 40 IBU brew. Cheers!

beers.name: Sticky Rice
beers.description: This week's NoDable is a Japanese style rice lager brewed with fancy sushi rice and a touch of Sorachi Ace hops. 'Sticky Rice' is mild on hops and malt, but the rice allows the malt to come through and create a unique sweetness in the beer. Come down to the tap room to grab a pint of this tasty fusion!

beers.name: Tart Your Engines
beers.description: Berliner Weisse (or as well like to call it…NorthCarolinerWeisse)  with lemon grass, ginger, seeds of paradise and honey added.

beers.name: Top of the Charts
beers.description: Hopped with a total of 5 different hops, and using four malts, Chad & Bart blended their individual IPA recipes (each using the same base IPA recipe but different hops) to come up with this week’s NoDable Series Release.

beers.name: TriUmphant
beers.description: Behold Tri-Umphant! A Belgian style Tripel brewed with all traditional Belgian malts, continental hops, Belgian yeast and enough Belgian candi-sugar to make an Umpalumpa blush. The rich esters from our Belgian yeast will fill your nose, mouth and soul with a feeling of accomplishment never seen before in a macro beer world.

beers.name: Winter Rose
beers.description: Our first NoDable Series release of 2012 is Winter Rose, a blonde ale for the colder season.  With a clean 6% ABV, our American blonde ale is spiced heavily with rosemary and infused twice with clover & sourwood honey.

beers.name: Woody & Wilcox
beers.description: An American IPA with an assertive hop character and balancing malty backbone. The hops used give it a piney, citrus laced aroma and a bright, earthy bittering finish. It uses Columbus, Magnum, Cascade and Santiam hops throughout the brew to achieve this hop character and utilizes four different malts to give it the golden amber colored body and the flavor of caramel along with some toasty bread notes.

beers.name: Zest Fest
beers.description: Belgian Ale.  First fermented on saison yeast and then finished with Belgian wit yeast.  Infused with Valencia orange peels & seeds of paradise and hopped heavily with sorachi ace hops.

beers.name: Doubloon Double Pale Ale
beers.description: Doubloon DPA uses the finest ingredients on the market to give this 8.5% ABV double pale ale a great taste and smooth finish. Additionally, just like pirate ales of old, the Doubloon is unfiltered and naturally carbonated. While this increases the production time, it helps increase mouthfeel and adds robust flavor.

beers.name: Gallows Point Dead Man's Porter
beers.description: Our Fall & Winter Seasonal, Gallows Point, is an Imperial Porter made with real Chocolate & Macadamia Nuts. There is nothing on the market like it, and it was recently named one of the Top 20 American Porters in the United States by BeerAdvocate.

beers.name: Maelstrom India Pale Ale
beers.description: Our Flagship ale is brewed with the finest imported malts from England, Maris Otter and Carastan, and seven different Northwest hops. This unique combination packs a powerful punch, and is aptly named for being a “Maelstrom of Hops” on the taste buds.

beers.name: Pirate King Triple India Pale Ale
beers.description: The Skull Coast Pirate King is an unholy, downright damnable, alliance of the finest malts and hops assaulting your palate. No really. Clocking in at over 10% ABV, and more than 110 IBUs, the Pirate King will not only own your tongue, but make you question why in the world you wanted it in the first place. You'll give it up to the Pirate King willingly.

beers.name: Scallywag Extra Pale Ale
beers.description: Our Extra Pale Ale is brewed with real Almonds. The subtle complexity of flavors between the five different malts, almonds and East Kent Goldings hops is one of the reasons Scallywag recently won Best Brew at the Gastonia Brew Festival.

beers.name: Sea Witch Watermelon Wheat Ale
beers.description: Our Summer Seasonal uses real watermelons along with our crisp, clean wheat ale recipe to create the perfect brew for a hot Summer’s day. If you are looking to escape the heat, Sea Witch will lure you in and refresh you. But, be careful... Ye be warned!

beers.name: Belgian Blonde Ale
beers.description: This golden-blonde Belgian style ale uses a traditional yeast strain which gives a gentle citrusy flavor and fruity aroma.  Saaz hops and light spices balance the sweetness from the Pilsen malt and provide an earthy taste.  A refreshing ale with a crisp, dry finish.

beers.name: Black Bear Stout
beers.description: Black Bear Stout is a robust, full-bodied beer with a rich roasted malt flavor and hints of dark chocolate and coffee.

beers.name: Copperhead Amber Ale
beers.description: The Copperhead Amber Ale is a crisp, medium bodied ale witha deep copper color and a rich, caramel, malty sweetness, balanced with a light floral hops flavor.

beers.name: India Pale Ale
beers.description: Our IPA utilizes 3 varieties of hops throughout the 90 minute boil and 5 in the fermenter to dry hop. Even at 95 IBU’s the hops flavor is well-balanced from nose to finish.

beers.name: Southern Appalachian Pilsner
beers.description: German Pilsen malt and a generous amount of Saaz hops give this lager a great spicy aroma followed by a pure, smooth malty taste.  A crisp, delightfully balanced finish makes this Bohemian style beer the perfect treat after a morning of pitching hot tar on a jailhouse rooftop.

beers.name: A Beer Named Sue Black Saison
Big Mon IPA
beers.description: A West Coast style IPA, grapefruit and citrus abounds. Assertively bitter.

beers.name: Country Pie Pecan Brown Ale
beers.description: Mmm Pecans

beers.name: Cryin’ Holy IIPA
beers.description: A citrus packed grapefruit flavor rounds off an intensely aromatic, and aggressively bitter IIPA. You’ll cry real good.

beers.name: Little Sadie’s Farmhouse Ale
beers.description: Rustic French Pale Ale, with pineapple and pear aromas. Fruity and Dry.

beers.name: Manzanita Black IPA
beers.description: Caramel, Biscuit, Chocolate and Carafa malts make for a sweet malty flavor, with notes of dark chocolate, fig and roast coffee

beers.name: No Quarter Coffee Stout
beers.description: An oatmeal and coffee stout made with Carrboro Coffee Roasters beans. Silky smooth and roasty

beers.name: Obvious Child
beers.description: Mixed Culture, unoaked sour ale made with foraged ingredients.

beers.name: Rubber Room
beers.description: Full bodied and low in alcohol with spicy rye character. Hoppy but Sessionable.

beers.name: Secret of Sound City Alt Bier
beers.description: A stronger, dry-hopped version of our alt bier. Aroma of candied fruit, and peppery herb, with a sourdough bread flavor.

beers.name: Secular & Non-Denominational Holiday Ale
beers.description: This crisp medium bodied spiced ale is perfect for any ubiquitous gathering of persons in the wintertime.

beers.name: Sound City Alt Bier
beers.description: Fermented at ale temps, then lagered to make it smooth and caramelly

beers.name: Thick Freakness Aged in Corn Whiskey Barrels
beers.description: Our biggest, boldness offering , Thickfreakness is made with rolled oats and wheat to give it an extra smooth mouth feel. Chocolatey & Brash

beers.name: 3C India Pale Ale
beers.description: Packed full of hop flavor with a lighter malt body, this American IPA showcases Citra, Centennial and Chinook hops. Citrus, Grapefruit and Passionfruit dominate the nose and tongue in this hop bomb. Brewed on a limited basis because of short supply of it's namesake hops.

beers.name: Baby Maker
beers.description: Ready to take it to the next level? This DIPA is fueled by hop flavor and aroma with enough bitterness to back the big malt body. Enjoy responsibly, this one's aptly named.

beers.name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Up All Night
Golden Boy
beers.description: A golden colored ale with a toasted malt character and slight Mt Hood hop flavor and aroma. Perfect on a hot summer day.

beers.name: Greenway IPA
beers.description: Our take on this classic American style has a blend of 5 different hops to create a mix of citrus, floral and piney hop flavors and aromas. Just as Greenways are a natural escape from a city, take a break from the chaos of life to enjoy a fine IPA.

beers.name: Hyzer Hefeweizen
beers.description: This traditional Hefe is big on banana and clove flavors from the yeast, with a sweet finish from the wheat heavy malt bill. A perfect beer to enjoy on a sunny day with the Carolina blue sky above.

beers.name: Kind Of A Big Deal (w/ Peaches)
beers.description: Imperial Honey Wheat Ale aged in Bourbon Barrels with Peaches added.

beers.name: Kind of a Big Deal - Blood Orange
Light Rail Pale Ale
beers.description: This pale ale has a light malt back bone that supports a big citrus hop flavor and aroma. In honor of our nearby New Bern Light Rail Station, ride safe and sustainably.

beers.name: Road To Nowhere
beers.description: A dark and smooth bodied ale with chocolate and nutty malt flavors, blended with a mild piney hop flavor and aroma.

beers.name: Sal's Paradise Saison
beers.description: Perfect for the warming weather, this refreshing Saison was brewed with malt grown in Western NC and malted at Riverbend Malthouse in Asheville, NC. The unique lemon and dill hop profile comes from a large amount of Sorachi Ace hops. Named after the lead character in one of our favorite novels, we hope this Saison will enlighten your day.

beers.name: Smoked Amber
beers.description: Cherry Wood Smoked Malt and English Golden Naked Oats give this beer a truly unique flavor. Slight smokiness pairs well with the nuttiness from the oats and great flavor from German Chocolate Wheat Malt.

beers.name: The Force
beers.description: Its name originates from when sometimes in brewing you just have to use your gut, or The Force, to know what ingredient and how much of it to use. Dominated by a fruit and pepper Belgian yeast aroma and flavor, it's 8.8 % abv originates from a big pilsner malt backbone and Belgian Candy Sugar.

beers.name: Up All Night
beers.description: A real eye-opener.  This ale is brewed with Flaked Oats, Special B, and Chocolate Malt in the mash. Honey and lactose are added in the boil, then aged on oak chips and infused with locally roasted coffee

beers.name: 10/6th IPA
beers.description: Bold and refreshing, this IPA combines an abundance of hops with a smooth malt profile. It is however, uniquely brewed to be like no other because it is a subtle IPA, not an overpowering single note.

beers.name: Absolom's Ale
beers.description: Light bodied, clean, crisp tasting yet has a bit of character. Absolom’s Ale has a very faint fruitiness and a medium light hop presence leaving a pleasant hop bite.

beers.name: Alice's Blonde Ale
beers.description: Behold the tangy influences of the yeast, assertive malt, and light, hoppy flavor. Illusional confessions of allspice and fruit.

beers.name: Cheshires Pumpkin Ale
beers.description: Malt and hops accented with roasted pumpkin and spices of the season. A subtle hint of seasonal spices.

beers.name: Drink Me Cream Ale
beers.description: Full-flavored beer. Rich. Robust. Quickly mellows, leaving the palate with a subtle hint of fruit.

beers.name: Dubbel Trouble
beers.description: A deep reddish, moderately strong, malty, complex Belgian Dubbel ale.

beers.name: Dunkin Dormhouse Octoberfest
beers.description: The Dunkin’ Dormouse is a true German brew, with malt and Noble hops from the Hallertau region in Bavaria. The result is a full, rich-bodied, mildly hopped seasonal lager. Crisp and refreshing, its appearance of a deep color like most Oktoberfest lagers, with full carbonation, make it a perfect fit for the style.

beers.name: Father William's Black Lager
beers.description: Robust and smooth, this full-flavored lager is exceptionally drinkable, crisp and refreshing, yet light bodied.

beers.name: Gryphon's California Common
beers.description: The California Common, or Steam Beer, is a unique 100% American style lager. It’s usually brewed with a special strain of lager yeast that works better at warmer temperatures. This method dates back to the late 1800’s in California when refrigeration was a great luxury. The brewers back then had to improvise to cool the beer down, so shallow fermenters were used. So in a way the lager yeast was trained to ferment quicker at warmer temperatures. Today’s examples are light amber to tawny in color, medium bodied with a malty character. Mildly fruity with an assertive hop bitterness.

beers.name: Jabberwocky Tripel
beers.description: Our Tripel Belgian Style Ale opens with a mild blast of hops that slowly gives way to the fruity esters implied by our Belgian yeast strain. In the Belgian tradition of brewing singles, doubles and triples, Trippel is the strongest with the longest fermentation. Remarkably smooth and complex, it is more of a sipping beer.

beers.name: Pale in the Park
beers.description: Begins with slight malt flavor with a subtle sweetness. Hop character pounces with a light flavor of spices. Finishes dry with an infusion of sweet hoppiness.

beers.name: Queen's Red Ale
beers.description: A deep reddish color, light hop character red ale leaving a light to medium bitterness. It is a balanced beer; medium bodied, moderate mouthfeel, well blended malty-ness with a light fruitiness.

beers.name: Rabbit's Nutbrown Ale
beers.description: This English-style brown ale has an alluring mahogany color capped by a rich foam head. Although dark in color, this is is brewed with several different varieties of premium malted barley, creating a robust body and delicious flavor profile. Its ripe fruit notes and sweet finish are counterbalanced by a subtle hop bitterness and aroma.

beers.name: Tea Party Porter
beers.description: A superb vanilla porter, an ale which is surprisingly light bodied for its robust flavor and has all the chocolate and roasted nut flavors you would expect in a porter but with a special vanilla twist at the end. We use the worlds finest hand selected vanilla beans in our recipe. The malty and vanilla sweetness are perfectly balanced with hoppy bitterness.

beers.name: White Knight Blackberry Ale
beers.description: This limited release fills your summer days (and glass) with the taste of rich blackberries, a smooth malty sweetness, and a hint of refreshing tartness.

beers.name: Barrel Roll Bourbon Porter
beers.description: Traditional English porter with strong coffee notes aged in a bourbon barrel

beers.name: Big Sky Rye
beers.description: Golden rye ale with earthy hop and spice undertones and full malt body

beers.name: BlackBerry Chocolate Barrel Aged Stout
beers.description: Rich chocolate malt based stout flavored with blackberries and aged to perfection in bourbon barrel

beers.name: BlackWater Rye IPA
beers.description: Black IPA brewed with rye malts with a spicy chocolate finish

beers.name: Brown Mountain Dark Ale
beers.description: Crisp dark ale with hints of coffee and toffee in the finish

beers.name: Chocolate Cherry Stout
beers.description: Our American style stout with notes of chocolate and flavored with cherry

beers.name: Folkmalt Mango Lager
beers.description: The perfect summer beer made with lager yeast. It is crisp and lightly flavored with mango

beers.name: Harvest Ale
beers.description: A light amber ale that is brewed with fresh hops that are locally grown. The hops used in this beer are harvested the day they are used in the brewing process

beers.name: Hi Bear Nation Pale Ale
beers.description: West coast style pale ale with El Dorado and nelson sauvin hops

beers.name: High Brace ESIPA
beers.description: Extra Special India Pale Ale with floral notes and a strong citrus finish

beers.name: Minorcan Porter
beers.description: World’s first chocolate, datil pepper porter is rich and satisfying with a mild heat finish

beers.name: Mud Bug Barrel Aged Stout
beers.description: Rich American style stout with strong chocolate and coffee notes is aged in a bourbon barrel for 6 months to create a nice balance of bourbon, chocolate and rich malt flavor

beers.name: Neapolitan Blown Apart
beers.description: Deconstructed Neapolitan beer that we brew in two parts. It is then blended and aged in an oak barrel. It includes hints of berry, vanilla and chocolate like its namesake

beers.name: Nick's Crick
beers.description: Belgian style beer with hints of molasses spiced with crystallized ginger and tangerine rind

beers.name: Octoberfest
beers.description: German Munich style beer made with lager yeast in the style of traditional Oktoberfest beers served in Germany

beers.name: Paddle Free ESB
beers.description: Perfectly balanced malt forward English Favorite.

beers.name: Paint Rock Porter
beers.description: Rich, dark, and malty with a thick creamy head and strong notes of coffee

beers.name: Pecan Pie Porter
beers.description: Our premium porter brewed with fresh pecans, oats, honey and brown sugar

beers.name: Pumpkin PFD
beers.description: Like autumn in a glass, made with pumpkin with notes of roasted almonds, toffee, cinnamon and nutmeg

beers.name: Red Ear Slider
beers.description: This is our Red India Pale Ale that uses clean bitter German hops to balance the caramel tones of the red robust malt that make this well balanced beer

beers.name: Rip Current Red
beers.description: A rich and flavorful red ale that is well rounded with a garnet color and great paired with most foods

beers.name: Shining Creek Bourbon Aged Red
beers.description: Brewed with crystal malts, honey and cinnamon and aged in a bourbon cask for three months to enhance the berry and spice notes of this very special English style red ale

beers.name: Sliding Rock Ale
beers.description: Light and refreshing English Mild ale that is malt forward.

beers.name: Snownado Stout
beers.description: A mind blowing blend of rich chocolate stout finished with a hint of cool mint.

beers.name: Strawberry Blonde
beers.description: A nice celebration of local strawberry blended with our Delta Blonde

beers.name: Sunburst Saison
beers.description: Made in the traditional belgian style, this saison is robust with a nice touch of blood orange. It has a wondeful dry finish.

beers.name: Three Bears
beers.description: We took this exceptional belgian tripel and aged it in a Spanish Port Barrel. The result is a very smooth and rare offering.

beers.name: Upper Falls IPA
beers.description: This is our Big IPA that is a smooth, crisp and clean as a mountain lake but bold like a waterfall

beers.name: White Water Hefeweizen
beers.description: This is a full bodied Hefeweizen with a great banana clove nose. It is perfectly balanced for a refreshing beer.

beers.name: Amber Ale
beers.description:
There is a broad spectrum of Amber Ales in this country.  Some in this style have a very malt forward presence with restrained hop bitterness, while brewers on the west coast have popularized bigger hoppier versions of the style.

We prefer to take things a little easier in the high country, so we brew our Amber Ale to be an easy drinking, well balanced beer that starts with a soft hop nose and finishes with a nice malty sweetness. 

With the highways being as curvy as they are in the mountains, sometimes it's better to be in the middle of the road.

beers.name: American Pale Ale
beers.description:
A building is only as good as it's foundation.  That's why we consider Pale Ale to be our bedrock.  

We wanted to create a well balanced beer that anybody can enjoy.  Our Pale Ale is a full-bodied ale that's deep copper in color.  The malty sweetness of the mash is offset by a generous amount of Magnum bittering hops.  The remainder of the late addition hops contribute a delightful citrus/floral note that will lighten anybody's spirits.

It's a great introduction for people who are interested in trying something other than the “standard” beers in the marketplace.

beers.name: Belgian Tripel
beers.description:
If you like big complex beers, look no further.  Our Tripel is brewed using a simple malt bill and only a few hop additions.  While the malt and hops do contribute to the final product it's really the yeast that's on display here.  

We've had guests tell us they taste hints of raisins, plums, apricots, tangerines, and some spicy notes they can't quite explain.  Neither can we, because we don't add anything other than the basic four  ingredients (water, barley, hops and yeast).  However, due to the strain of yeast and the fermentation process, it produces all these wonderful flavors.  

Be careful, many have been lured in by her delicate lacing, sweet aromas and intricate flavors only to realize she's a big 9% beer that will sneak up on you if you over indulge.  Don't worry, that's what our lodging is for.  Enjoy!

beers.name: Cream Ale
beers.description:
Most of America's beer styles have been imported from Europe.  However, Cream Ale is one of the distinctly American styles and it's seeing a resurgence in craft brewing.  

Our Cream Ale began it's life as a summer seasonal, but quickly turned into one of the staples of our lineup. Our Cream Ale is a crisp, clean, easy-drinking light hybrid beer.  The hops provide a subtle spicy/sweet aroma while the yeast produces a nice crisp finish due to the cooler fermentation temperature.  

It's the perfect beer to compliment a great round of disc golf.

beers.name: India Pale Ale
beers.description:
Although the IPA style wasn't an American invention we certainly have made it our own.  Historically, hops were used primarily for their preservative characteristics to keep the beer palatable on long journeys. 

Many examples of American IPAs tend to be hop “bombs” that will make you pucker up with that “bitter beer face”.  We brew our IPA with just the right amount of bittering hops, but we make sure to focus on the more delicate qualities of humulus lupulus. That's why we load it up with late addition hops that inundate the senses with piney, citrusy and floral contributions.  

Not that there's anything wrong with hop “bombs”.  Quite the contrary in fact...that's why we brew a Double IPA.

beers.name: Nut Brown Ale
beers.description:
What would a squirrel be without his nuts?  

We selected certain malts for our grain bill that give it that nutty/toasted flavor that squirrels love.  We keep the hop additions to a minimum in order for those malty flavors and aromas to shine through.  We ferment with a clean neutral yeast that provides for a nice smooth malty finish with just enough residual sweetness that will keep you wanting more.  

After all, have you ever seen a squirrel stop at just one nut?

beers.name: Stout
beers.description:
Many people will avoid this category when trying new beers.  They don't like to drink motor oil and honestly, who can blame them?  While our Stout is definitely a dark beer and will keep you well lubricated, it's far from motor oil.  

The specialty grains and fresh yeast provide a wonderful complex beer that delights even the most discernible palate.  The roasted character will dominate the first sip, but easing right in behind it will be hints of coffee, vanilla, chocolate and other wonderful toasted flavors and aromas.  

The next time you're at the lodge don't be afraid to come over to the dark side.  Who knows, you might just stay awhile.

beers.name: American Wheat Ale
beers.description: Our American style wheat beer pours clear gold with frothy, white head. This brew is perfectly balanced with a subtle, grainy foundation and a tangy, sweet finish. This beer is not filtered, but made to be clear and clean without excessive yeast overtones.

beers.name: Barley Wine
beers.description: Our American style barley wine is aged in Heaven Hill bourbon barrels on-site. This style of ale originated in 18th century England, during a time when traditional barley wines were very strong and served as healing drinks. We age this lively brew at the optimal time and conditions necessary to create an intense body with a complex, yet smooth finish.

beers.name: Belgian Dark Strong Ale
beers.description: Our dark Belgian Ale is thoroughly unique in its qualities of fruity aroma, deep rich flavors from the selection of various dark malts and Belgian dark candy sugar we use along with the addition of figs in the fermentation, spiced with allspice and mace to make this strong ale our most complex and most wonderful offering so far. 9.5% ABV, 29 ibus.

beers.name: Belgian Pale Ale
beers.description: The distinctive, fruity and aromatic qualities of Belgian yeast resonate to bring perfect balance to the full-bodied maltiness of this classic ale. This beer is not too strong, but robust in the complexity of its flavors and aromas. Hints of floral hops and fruity aromas blend with a crisp, hoppy aftertaste to create a light, refreshing brew.

beers.name: Big Chocolate Porter
beers.description: Our Big Chocolate offers an innovative twist to the traditional porter. Chocolate and roasted Carafa malts provide a base of bittersweet chocolate and mocha. It is then dry nibbed with raw cocoa in the fermenter and finished with a touch of vanilla bean to create the perfect balance between bitter and sweet. This beer offers the taste of roasted coffee and cocoa with dry, smoky undertones.

beers.name: Black IPA
beers.description: Our signature Black IPA transforms the traditional. The Black Patent and the roasted barley malts used in stouts and porters create a deeply opaque and robust foundation. Magnum, Galena and Cascade hops are added to provide familiar citrus bitterness that compliments the deeply roasted grain bill. The dark malts and non- traditional hop profile blend together to create an elegantly balanced brew with a toasted nut and hop-centric flavor.

beers.name: Double IPA
beers.description: Our Double IPA packs a strong punch and never loses the delicate characteristics of a traditional IPA. This brew pours a golden, chestnut brown and has a distinct, fruity hop aroma that compliments its lively and fresh flavor. Citrus and floral notes blend with a slight caramel maltiness. The Double IPA was created in England to withstand long travel to its colonies. Today, we’re only worried about the distance from the tap to your glass!

beers.name: Extra Special Bitter
beers.description: For our ESB, we used some of its English roots to bring a little England to you! We use British 2-row malts to create authentic, satisfying sweetness. Toasty, caramel undertones pair with a moderate hop load that provides the earthy bitterness and balance that defines this brew. The traditional characteristics of this beer combine with our clear mountain water and signature brewing techniques to turn this ESB into a must try!

beers.name: Farmhouse Peach Ale
beers.description: This seasonal ale is brewed with Belgian yeast and premium biscuit malt. Peaches are added during fermentation to create subtle nuances of fresh peach. This medium-bodied beer offers a delicious combination of baked bread flavors and fresh ripe peaches.

beers.name: Grandfather's Breakfast Stout
beers.description: Warm the morning or top off the day with our Grandfather’s Breakfast  Stout.  Brewed with specialty malts, house-toasted oats and natural cocoa powder. Maple syrup is added during fermentation with a touch of locally roasted Bald Guy cold-pressed Sumatran Wahana coffee.  This brew is among our most decadent and complex seasonal offerings, exhibiting nuances of mocha, toasted nut, and spice.

beers.name: High Country Ale
beers.description:
This American style Ale is fermented with a proprietary ale yeast strain that provides a distinct fruity-ester aroma and flavor. The deep golden product is characterized by a balanced hop bitterness and evident but not overwhelming hops aroma. The kettle hopping is derived from American Cascade & Centennial hops, with generous dry hopping during post-fermentation aging.
The medium body and crisp grainy character are created by a domestic malt bill of 2-Row and Munich Style malts.

beers.name: Imperial Stout
beers.description: This style of stout was originally brewed for the Czar of Russia, so today we brew our Imperial Stout to be fit for royalty! Our Imperial pours a very dark black and is characterized by a rich, malty flavor enhanced with the addition of molasses. A slight licorice aroma brings our Imperial Stout full circle and rounds out the drinking experience of this hefty brew.

beers.name: IPA
beers.description: Our Blowing Rock IPA pours a copper color through the incorporation of 2- Row and other specialty malts. Balanced hop additions provide evident but not overwhelming hop bitterness, while the finishing and dry hops offer an elegant hop complexity. Citrus and floral notes are balanced with a slight hint of caramel maltiness. This beer is full-bodied and flavorful, yet thoughtfully integrated.

beers.name: Midnight Raspberry Wheat
beers.description: Brewed with dark roasted wheat and fermented with real raspberries. Finishes mellow and sweet.

beers.name: Mountain Shadow Black IPA
beers.description: Our Mountain Shadow Black IPA transforms the traditional. The roasted barley malts utilized in stouts and porters provide a bold foundation and unique character. Magnum and Galena hops compliment the deeply roasted grain bill, resulting in an elegantly balanced Ale with toasted nut and hop-centric flavors.

beers.name: Oktoberfest
beers.description: Our Blowing Rock Oktoberfest is the ideal Märzen style German Oktoberfest brew. This lager pours a brilliant, golden copper and its malty aroma evokes notes of breaded caramel. A subtle hop profile creates a malt-forward presence with a smooth finish to this well-balanced, seasonal brew.

beers.name: Pilsner
beers.description: Our traditional Czechoslovakian Pilsner won the gold medal at the Carolina’s Championship of Beer. It is brewed with German malt and Czech hops to create a perfect compliment of malt sweetness and body to the distinctive bitterness and aroma typical of this lager style. This beer is perfect evidence that light-bodied brews don’t have to be light in flavor. Our Pilsner drinks crisp and smooth, and still offers a richness of flavor.

beers.name: Roasted Pumpkin Ale
beers.description: Our brewers roasted 160 pounds of North Carolina’s first pumpkin harvest to celebrate the glorious taste of fall. Premium biscuit and crystal malts provide a base of toasted bread and caramel with additions of vanilla bean, whole clove, cinnamon and mace that combine to create seasonal brew unlike any other.

beers.name: Schwarz Bier
beers.description: Our Schwartz is a dark, German lager full of a traditional dark beer flavor, but with less of a heavy-bodied feel. This brew has a mildly roasted malt character and flavors of both caramel and toffee. First produced in Saxony, Germany, the Schwartz Bier is believed to have been consumed since the Middle Ages.

beers.name: Scotch Ale
beers.description: Our Scotch Ale pours a dark, chestnut brown. Its malty caramel aromas compliment a balanced malt bill and slight hop bitterness to give this brew a smooth, refreshing finish.

beers.name: Stonefruit Saison
beers.description: French Saison yeast with peaches and apricots added during fermentation. Crisp & refreshing in the French countryside tradition.

beers.name: Summer Ale
beers.description: Our Summer Ale is often compared to a Belgian Witbier, as it is fermented with a Belgian Ale Yeast. This pale ale has a grain bill of domestic pale malt and white wheat. Kettle hopping is done with signature Czech Saaz hops that provide well-balanced bitterness. A late addition of orange peel and toasted coriander spice provides the finishing touch. The haze provides a nice background for this medium bodied beer marked with a lemon and orange zest.

beers.name: Baldwin Belgian IPA
beers.description: This Belgian IPA combines the hoppy character of an American IPA style with the spicy notes and fruity esters of many Belgian styles. European hop varieties are traditionally used in this style of beer, however, we elected to stick with the good ole USA grown hops using a good dose of Simcoe, Amarillo, Centennial and Citra hops.   We used 2 separate Belgian yeast strains in order to produce the unique flavor profile of this very drinkable IPA.

beers.name: Blue Ridge Brutal Brown
beers.description: Originally brewed as a special one-off for the 2014 Blue Ridge Brutal event, this Nutty Brown Ale with a touch of local Honey became so popular that it is now brewed on a regular basis

beers.name: Chief's Cherry Stout
