beers.description: Using a hefty amount of Maris Otter malted grain and generous amounts of Chocolate and de-bittered Black Malt, combined with flaked Oats and Barley, we created a unique roasted malt backbone for this Stout. We added Perle, Northern Brewer and Fuggle hops at various intervals and kicked it up a notch by adding a good amount of Tart Cherries to balance out the sweetness of the malts and the bitterness of the hops.

beers.name: Claybank Kolsch
beers.description:
This refreshing German style beer has a bright, straw-yellow hue, and a prominent but not extreme hoppiness.  This style of beer is often compared to a German Pale Lager, although less bitter. 

This Kölsch was brewed using Belgian Pilsner Malt, Vienna Malt and Crystal Malt which provides for a lite beer with distinct malty notes.  A combination of Magnum, Amarillo, Saaz and Styrian Goldings hops were used to provide a slight “bite” and floral aroma.

Named for one of our local Ashe County Roads that provides safe travel to several of our employees and friends each day.

beers.name: Crumpler Crippler Citra 2XIPA
beers.description: Hailing from an Ashe County gem, Crumpler, and Weighing in at 8.5% and packing a Crippling punch of around 90 IBUs of all Citra hops, this Double IPA packs a wallop without totally knocking your head off. A very drinkable IPA with the trademark citrus aroma and flavor of the highly sought after Citra hops. Best enjoyed fresh

beers.name: Honey Orange Kolsch
beers.description: A kolsch style beer that is light in ABV but full of flavor. Using local honey, Honey Malt and Sweet Orange peel we've created a nice balanced beer that is drinkable through all of the seasons.

beers.name: JMB Stout
beers.description:
Named after our owner’s father, James Martin Brown, who passed away suddenly and unexpectedly the day that the first batch of this rich Chocolate Stout was brewed.

This Imperial Stout is brewed with 6 varieties of malted barley that results in a silky smooth, yet complex beer. This beer pours out with a frothy tan head that would make Starbucks envious. It is loaded with chocolate and coffee aromas and pleasing malty notes. It has a rich mouth feel, is somewhat sweet and nicely balanced by the hops.

beers.name: JMB Stout
beers.description:
Named after our owner’s father, James Martin Brown, who passed away suddenly and unexpectedly the day that the first batch of this rich Chocolate Stout was brewed.

This Imperial Stout is brewed with 6 varieties of malted barley that results in a silky smooth, yet complex beer.  This beer pours out with a frothy tan head that would make Starbucks envious.  It is loaded with chocolate and coffee aromas and pleasing malty notes.  It has a rich mouth feel, is somewhat sweet and nicely balanced by the hops.

beers.name: Third Knob Truth Serum
beers.description:
This unique Belgian Tripel style beer will have you sharing all of your secrets if you are not careful.  A large amount of Pilsen Malt combined with a generous amount of Belgian Candi Sugar provides the base for our Abbey style yeast to do its thing.   Just the right amount of Hops are used to provide a slight bitterness which is offset by the addition of Coriander seed and Orange peel, giving this Boondocks Brew it’s unique flavor.

Given the “High Gravity” of this beer we felt it appropriate to reference Ashe County’s own Third Knob Summit (elevation 3930 feet), about where you will be if you have one too many.

beers.name: Third Knob Truth Serum Belgian Tripel
beers.description:
This unique Belgian Tripel style beer will have you sharing all of your secrets if you are not careful. A large amount of Pilsen Malt combined with a generous amount of Belgian Candi Sugar provides the base for our Abbey style yeast to do its thing. Just the right amount of Hops are used to provide a slight bitterness which is offset by the addition of Coriander seed and Orange peel, giving this Boondocks Brew it’s unique flavor.

Given the “High Gravity” of this beer we felt it appropriate to reference Ashe County’s own Third Knob Summit (elevation 3930 feet), about where you will be if you have one too many.

beers.name: West Jefferson Centennial Ale
beers.description: Brewed to celebrate West Jefferson's Centennial. This Pale Ale brewed with Centennial Hops, local Fraser Fir Christmas Tree Tips and local Honey provide a unique, well balanced Pale Ale with that little something extra

beers.name: American IPA
beers.description: Though we focus on lagers, this India Pale Ale was too good not to serve.  The hallmark of a great IPA is drinkability, and this beer is no exception. Five separate hop additions make this beer explode with citrusy hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma.   Medium-light bodied and superbly quaffable,  be careful with this one because the 6.0% alcohol content sneaks up on you quickly!

beers.name: American Premium Lager
beers.description: Brevard Brewing Company's lightest offering, yet so delicious it proves it's OK for beer geeks to drink "lawnmower beer".  It is packed with more flavor than you will find in the average American canned beer, but light enough to drink all summer day long.  Brevard Premium Lager is perfect for any occasion, whether watching a ball game or chatting with friends.

beers.name: American Red Ale
beers.description: This American-style ale pours a deep ruby-red color.  The liberal use of special malts produces an unmistakable caramel flavor, while American west-coast hops provide a pronounced hop flavor and aroma.  Medium bodied and perfectly balanced between malt and hops, this is a real crowd pleaser.

beers.name: Bohemian Pilsner
beers.description: Brevard Brewing Company's flagship beer, the Bohemian Pilsner is everything that beer should be.  Cold lager fermentation and a medium-light body produce a crisp, clean, and smooth mouthfeel.  Imported noble hops from the Czech Republic and Germany lend a floral aroma and spicy hop flavor, while extremely soft brewing water creates soft, round flavors.  This beer is the perfect marriage of flavor and drinkability.

beers.name: Munich Dunkel
beers.description: Brevard Brewing Company's darkest beer--finally, a welcome alternative to the mandatory Porter found in nearly every craft brewery line-up in the country.  Dunkel literally means "dark" in German, but don't let the dark color fool you.  This is still a German lager beer.  While chocolate malt and an abundance of German Munich malts provide a solid malt backbone, the medium body and lager fermentation make this beer surprisingly drinkable.  If a Porter and an Oktoberfest had a baby, this would be it.  Tastes like a dark beer, but drinks like a Pilsner.

beers.name: Brass Ring
beers.description: Some malt notes, with a sweet, aroma, rich brass color and brilliant sparkling clarity. Neither malt nor hops prevail in the taste. With the rich, creamy white head, medium body and crisp taste, it is a thirst quenching treat that finishes faintly sweet.

beers.name: Dugan's Chocolate
beers.description: It is almost opaque in color, packed with sweet roasted malted flavors. Chocolate stands out in this creamy ale. Bitterness has been replaced with creamy chocolate and coffee notes.

beers.name: Flying Circus
beers.description: This beer is German in origin and has a cloudy appearance is pale in color.  A hint of coconut and banana flavor along with strong carbonation makes this fun beer perfect for a sunny day.

beers.name: Fox 2
beers.description: An Irish Red Ale made with English 2 Row Malt Barley and enough Chipotle Peppers to put a little "heat(er) in your chest," in about 6 to 9 seconds.

beers.name: Harley Pope
beers.description: This fine vanilla porter is our way of honoring 1st LT Harley Pope. He crashed and died at the Cape Fear River in Jan 1919 while on a mapping expedition in the Curtiss Jenny.

beers.name: Hat in The Ring
beers.description: This American IPA is different from the English IPA style. Its color is a light bronze. We use the perfect amount of American and English malts, to create a big herbal and citrus character.

beers.name: Wendy's
beers.description: This Ale has a light malty palate, some fruitiness, a pleasant hop bouquet and gold color. With the touch of Pomegranate we added, we think it is perfect.

beers.name: Wright Flyer
beers.description: This refreshingly creamy Ale has pale straw color with a medium head and carbonation. It is light, crisp, and lightly hopped with plenty of body. Its finish is fairly sweet, smooth and thirst quenching.

beers.name: Wrong Way Corrigan
beers.description: Our Stout has a very dark appearance with a roasted flavor. It is slightly dry and a sweetness is also notable in this ale. A hint of a hop aroma will be followed by a taste of toffee. The creamy brown head will last until the finish.

beers.name: Blonde Ale
beers.description: While this beer is light in color, it’s not lacking in flavor.  This easy drinking beer has fruity and floral notes with a clean finish. A healthy dose of wheat malt adds to the complexity you would expect from a blonde.

beers.name: Classic Session Ale
beers.description: The definition of a session beer, this 3.9% perfectly balanced English Pale Ale will keep you coming back for more. A slightly biscuity malt backbone supports the earthy English hops to provide great drinkability from the keg or from the cask!

beers.name: Coffee Amber
beers.description: Our Coffee Amber brings two of our favorite flavors together. Smooth coffee notes from amber malts and a rich back bone from UK grains join up for a rich unique drinking experience.  Hints of plums in the background. Pairs well with red meats, pork and any breakfast item imaginable.

beers.name: English IPA
beers.description: While most American IPAs are all about the hops, we have created a more traditional English IPA that has a great hop profile, but is nicely balanced by a bready, caramel malt bill.  A mix of UK and US hops confront you in the aroma and provide a complex bitterness with flavors from spicy to earthy and citrusy.  The body of this IPA is slightly sweet to provide balance to the hop bitterness, which results in a very smooth and drinkable IPA.

beers.name: English Session Ale
beers.description:
A model after an Ordinary Bitter, English Ale is anything but bitter.  Smooth malting with subtle bitterness from East Kent Golding hops, this sessionable ale is balanced and full of flavor.

Best enjoyed at around 50 degrees, and for those English purists, look for this beer being pulled from a cask in the traditional English style.

beers.name: ESB
beers.description: English Ale’s big brother. With a copper color this English specialty is the real deal. With notes of figs and sweet raisins, it’s countered by a healthy dose of East Kent Golding hops to give it a balance. A quintessential English beer, this Extra Special Bitter has found a new home in the states.

beers.name: Nut Brown Ale
beers.description: An amazing blend of malty biscuity flavors with a hint of caramel and a slight roasted character, this beer has layers of complexity, but is surprisingly smooth and easy to drink. It brings the deep richness of a porter, but the light drinkability of a brown ale.

beers.name: Offbeat Wheat
beers.description: English Wheat with Jarrylo hops. Clean and classic wheat with medium to low mouth feel and a pillow of white head. First sip brings some sweetness and notes of pear and orange from the Jarrylo hops. Finishes with a nice dry wheat character that leaves your taste buds ready for the next sip.

beers.name: Porter
beers.description: A beer made famous by the working class in the UK, Porter is smooth and lush. Layers of roastiness, chocolate and coffee await you with each pour.  Medium bodied with a tan head that follows you down to the bottom of the glass, this beer is drinkable year round.

beers.name: X-Pat IPA
beers.description: X-­Pat is a fusion of our English heritage and American passions. Using UK malts and  American hops this IPA pours copper in color with a big hop bouquet of grapefruit,  pine, floral sweetness.  A well rounded malt back bone evens out the bitterness for a  truly unique drinking experience.

beers.name: Baltimore Blonde
beers.description: A British style pale ale with plenty of citrus flavors and aromas. Peppery hop finish. Named for the owner and heart of the Full Moon…Sharon.

beers.name: Charon Stout
beers.description: A dry Irish stout with molasses caramel and toasted malt flavors. Stouts are robust full flavor porters but less filling and with fewer calories than most beers.

beers.name: Lost Colony Ale
beers.description: A northern English style of ale. Walnut-colored with a sweet malty taste, plus caramel, coffee and molasses flavors from the imported British malts.

beers.name: Black Lotus Porter
beers.description: Black Lotus is a heavy-bodied, chocolaty black ale with a malty roast flavor. Lotus is sure to tempt the palate of any beer coinsure. Black Lotus has the perfect amount of bittering hops to balance the intense malt profile.

beers.name: Distinction
beers.description: We use 9 different styles of malted barley & oatmeal flakes to give a roasted, chocolate & dark caramel flavor. Then balanced with medium hop bitterness. Pushed with straight nitrogen on tap to create a thick creamy head.

beers.name: Pilot Pale Ale
beers.description: Pilot Pale Ale is a deep straw colored, light bodied pale ale with a subtle hint of toasted malt. The hops add a floral and fruity profile to this Ale.

beers.name: Tea Off Wheat Ale
beers.description: Tea Off is a light bodied, full flavored wheat ale with a rich copper color. Green tea, orange peel, and coriander are incorporated in this wheat ale making it a refreshing choice on a hot day or night. Tea Off Ale beer that can truly be enjoyed by all.

beers.name: Action Man
beers.description: Action Man Lager is a Vienna Lager and has a reddish copper color with a light toasted malt aroma. Soft, elegant malt complexity is in the forefront with a firm enough hop bitterness to provide a balanced finish. At 5.1% alcohol by volume it is an easy drinking craft beer with a crisp finish suitable for enjoying all year round and pairing with all types of food

beers.name: Jalapeno Action Man
beers.description: A twist on a Howard Brewing classic with the addition of smoked Jalapeno, Poblano, Fresno, and Anaheim peppers to give this easy drinker just the right amount of heat!

beers.name: Sumac Cum Laude
beers.description: Belgian Style Saison brewed with Sumac Berries. Collaboration with Ivory Tower Brewery Appalachian State University Fermentation Science Program

beers.name: Trailhead Pale
beers.description: Trailhead Pale is an American Pale Ale showcasing flavors unique to ingredients indigenous to America (hops, malt, yeast, and water). Refreshing, hoppy and pale golden in color the pale ale has bready,toasty, and biscuit maly flavors supporting a fresh citrusy American ho character. At 5.6% alcohol it is a perennial favorite style amoung craft beer drinkers who have enjoyed a strong unique flavor and fresh chacter that is much different than the pilsner and light lagers offered by the large brewing companies.

beers.name: Coaches and Carriages Series: Bravetart
beers.description: This is an 80 shilling Scottish Ale brewed with Heather and Tamarind.

beers.name: Coaches and Carriages Series: Hollaback Hefeweizen
beers.description: Rum BBL Aged with Oak Chips, Cinnamon and Vanilla.

beers.name: High Rock Red Ale
beers.description: Influenced by traditional English pale ale, this innovative Red Ale was created with the use of Marris Otter and Rye, imparting a light biscuit flavor & spicy notes while drinking this beer.  The addition of English hops to finish this creation result in an enjoyable sweet hop flavor and aroma to tempt your taste buds.

beers.name: Old Stone House IPA
beers.description: Blending seven different hops, this dry hopped IPA will blow your mind with a citrusy flavor & bittering back end. The notion of this beer was to create a simple grain blend to give the hops a stage on which to become the stars.

beers.name: ​Hurley Park Blood Orange Wheat
beers.description: Red and pale malted wheat, aromatic hops, lemon grass and orange peel gives this ale a unique twist on classical wheat beers.  The addition of blood oranges late in the brewing process yields an unmistakable conflict of sweet & tart, resulting in an amazingly enjoyable beer.

beers.name: Village Tart
beers.description:
Cherry. Crisp. Tart.
She’s everything you’d expect. Sweet like a cherry and sharp as a tack, she puts a luster on the dullest mood. Tart montmorency cherries meld with tart apples for a delightful addition to any occasion. Just sweet enough.

beers.name: Haystack IPA
beers.description: Hay Stack IPA is stacked high with two row, Vienna and Caramel malts followed by Chinook and Cascade hops. A distinctive but not overbearing hop profile. Brewed to be enjoyed at a southern pace.

beers.name: Honey Do Golden Ale
beers.description: Honey Do Golden Ale is a lighter bodied golden ale with a slight sweet honey flavor.  We blended honey malt and local beekeeper honey to give this beer a subtle honey taste with a distinctive Saaz hop spiciness.  This warm weather ale offers easy drinkability for those new to craft beers but still provides plenty of flavor for craft beer lovers.

beers.name: Southern Pale Ale
beers.description: Southern Pale Ale is the perfect blend of two row and three other varieties of Caramel malts. Balanced with the floral and citrus notes from Centennial and Golding hops. Pairs well in any weather.

beers.name: Spicy Lemon Saison
beers.description: Originally from Belgium, this beer was intended as a thirst quencher for farmers during hot summer days in the field.  The beer has moderate earthy tones in the aroma, paired with citrus and spice.  The flavor starts with peppery-clove spiciness and finishes with a refreshingly tart spiced lemon character.

beers.name: Black Jack
beers.description: Black IPA

beers.name: Booghi Sattva American Pale Ale
beers.description: This pale ale focuses on whole cone Cascade hops in the recipe to add earthy, spicy hues to the flavor. Booghi Sattva is meant to refresh and will keep you coming back for more.

beers.name: Brah'klava
beers.description: Brewed in collaboration with our friends at Bluejacket in DC and Starpoint in Carborro to celebrate Beer Study’s third birthday, this baklava-inspired Belgian Golden Strong was brewed with a sizable portion of honey malt, 300 pounds of roasted pistachios, green cardamom, ceylon cinnamon and a touch of rose water, then aged in bourbon barrels for over six months.

beers.name: Mornin’ Wood Double India Pale Ale
beers.description: Brewed with 5 different malts and 4 different whole cone American hop varieties, Mornin’ Wood DIPA is well-balanced and full of flavor and body. The key to this recipe is balance. The malts and hops support each other and offer the best combinations for the high gravity beer.

beers.name: Surfin’ Buddha India Pale Ale
beers.description: This is the little brother to Mornin’ Wood DIPA. With a similar malt and hop profile this beer continues the flavor profile with a lower initial specific gravity but retaining the same full body and beautiful color.

beers.name: Dust Bunny Barrel Aged Wild Ale
beers.description: A barrel-aged saison fermented with eight different strains of brettanomyces

beers.name: Hi-yo, Saison!
beers.description: Farmhouse ale brewed with noble Motueka hops from New Zealand and fermented with a complex Belgian yeast strain from East Coast Yeast. Pale orange in color; dry, with a refreshingly bitter finish.

beers.name: Quentin’s Reserve Root Beer Porter
beers.description: A malt-forward, seal brown beer brewed with classic root beer ingredients including wintergreen and licorice, fermented by a traditional British ale yeast strain, and casked with vanilla beans and Northern Brewer hops.

beers.name: Zee Count
beers.description: A chocolate stout brewed with Count Chocula and aged in Videri cocoa nibs.

beers.name: Barrel of Monks Oak-Aged Belgian Stout
beers.description: Bold and luscious, this bourbon oak-aged Belgian Stout has plenty of complementary stout characteristics. It’s a complex heady brew with distinct chocolate flavor at the start and a strong coffee finish. Sure to please any stout aficionado!

beers.name: Blackened Monk
beers.description:
This nearly opaque Black IPA (aka Cascadian Dark Ale) has toasted caramel & roasted malt nose, with notes of pine and citrus.

As you begin to sip this highly drinkable ale, the Centennial and Citra dry-hopped character will come shining through, balancing the subtle roasted coffee flavor.

beers.name: Darth Monk
beers.description: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away.... well not so long ago and in the next room our brewmaster overcame the forces of evil (a broken mash tun) to create this beer. A tremendous amount of dark malts come together to create a tempting aroma of chocolate, coffee and roast. These aromas carry through into the flavor and are balanced by an intense malty sweetness. The maltiness dissipates quickly into a dry finish. Don’t be afraid of the dark side as Luke once was.

beers.name: Opus Opus
beers.description: Opus’ Opus was his gift to you before he left Asheville. Brewed with hops from Opus’ home garden, this English Pale Ale boasts a bright hop aroma with a balanced bitter front and caramel finish. As the beer temperature rises, notice the hops begin to mellow, making way for a smooth, subtle maltiness. Cheers to you, Opus!

beers.name: Swifty's Riverbend Amber
beers.description: Named after Barry’s dearly departed pooch, Swifty, this sessionable amber was brewed using local artisian malts from the Riverbend Malt House. The subtle hop flavor is balanced perfectly by smooth maltiness. Raise your glass to Swifty as he runs through that big field of barley in the sky!

beers.name: Pale of the Dragon
beers.description: An American Pale Ale. Refreshing and very hoppy with notes of citrus and a clean bitter finish. Just enough malt character to compliment the hops.

beers.name: Punch in the Face
beers.description: American IPA with lots of floral citrusy hops. Grapefruit, Orange and Pine are very strong up front with a heavy bitter finish. Light Golden color. Very low malt profile.

beers.name: 30 Fathoms
beers.description: This deep dark porter would easily make it safely through the Baltic Sea safely. And whomever received her at port would be rewarded with a beer that touts chocolate notes and a creamy tan head.

beers.name: Azacca D.A.V.E.
beers.description: The latest brew in our Single Hop D.A.V.E. series.  A New England Style Pale Ale with 100% Azacca Hops.

beers.name: Best in Show
beers.description: This beer is a bright and easy drinking farmhouse ale.  Grassy undertones give way to a blooming citrus nose that presents itself upon a sweeter malt base than many saisons.

beers.name: Biggest Flirt
beers.description: Hazy & deliciously floral and tropical aroma from the late hop addition of Nelson hops.

beers.name: Cloud Surfer
beers.description: We know the idea of a "New England IPA" style is still in debate, but we still feel it's the best way to describe this extremely dry hopped, minimal bitter addition IPA brewed with significant protein contribution from wheat and oats.

beers.name: Darryl
beers.description: Strawberry Session Ale.  The first in our Farmer's Market Series, brewed with 300 pounds of Patterson Farm strawberries

beers.name: El Hombre
beers.description: Horchata Stout brewed with Almond Tea, Cinnamon and Vanilla.

beers.name: Limbo Champ
beers.description: The beer pours a deep chestnut and imparts notes of chocolate. With a lighter mouthfeel than you might expect given the color of this beer you’ll be surprised how sessionable it is.

beers.name: Millions Of Peaches
beers.description: A bright saison aged briefly of fresh North Carolina peaches.

beers.name: Motueka D.A.V.E.
beers.description: The second installment in our Single Hop D.A.V.E. series.  A New England Style IPA with 100% Motueka Hops.

beers.name: Perfect Attendance Pils
beers.description: This upright citizen is pleasant company on a warm sunny afternoon. Brewed with all Czech Saaz hops, it has a crisp hop profile with a lightly sweet finish.

beers.name: Rookie Of The Year
beers.description: Pritchard's Rum Barrel Aged Robust Porter with Vanilla Beans

beers.name: Rose Gose
beers.description: German style Gose Brewed with salt and NC Rosemary

beers.name: Slingshot Coffee Porter
beers.description: Slingshot Coffee Porter brewed with Raleigh’s own Slingshot Coldbrew Coffee.  This robust porter assaults your senses with brilliant coffee aroma and finishes clean with notes of chocolate and roasted barley.

beers.name: Slingshot Porter
beers.description: Slingshot Coffee Porter brewed with Raleigh’s own Slingshot Coldbrew Coffee.  This robust porter assaults your senses with brilliant coffee aroma and finishes clean with notes of chocolate and roasted barley.

beers.name: The King
beers.description: Designed to please The King himself, this beer is built to wrap the flavors of peanut butter with banana esters and sit on a bready dubbel base. Lunch in a glass, enjoy.

beers.name: Trophinator
beers.description: The alcohol in this beer is hidden by the sweet presence of malty goodness that carries with it sensations of brown sugar and white raisins.

beers.name: Trophy Wife
beers.description: Light and approachable this beauty shows off a hint of Simcoe and a clean finish.

beers.name: Black Falls Black IPA
beers.description: Black Falls is our spring seasonal Black IPA. Deeply opaque with ruby hues, this brew features rich chocolate flavors and aromas accompanied by a huge load of fresh fruity hops. The dark malts of winter meet the citrus hops of summer; this is a marriage of beer's most flavorful components in beautiful balance.

beers.name: Emmalynn
beers.description: Playfully balanced with light Belgian malts, classic Belgian yeast, and subtle Noble hops, this blonde offers bright citrus and apricot aromas. Whether at an outdoor festival, splashing in the waves, or enjoying a quiet dinner, Emmalynn is the perfect companion.

beers.name: Foreign Extra Stout
beers.description: Foreign Extra Stout-White Street Stout is brewed to the UK export style. Notes of mocha, light smokiness, and a creamy mouthfeel round out this heavily roasted brew. The perfect choice for the winter months.

beers.name: Hoptimist IPA
beers.description: The Hoptimist IPA is a hop showcase that spares no expense to impart a positive outlook to the most discerning hop heads. This glass-half-full IPA has notes of pungent citrus and earthy resins with an uplifting malt balance. 65 IBU, 7.5% ABV.

beers.name: Koschei the Deathless Russian Imperial Stout
beers.description: Locked in bourbon barrels until we found and released him, Koschei the Deathless - our massive, complex, blacker-than-death Imperial Stout - will steal any soul with which he comes in contact. A Russian villain, Koschei’s immortality can only be reversed by finding his soul hidden in a needle, inside a duck’s egg, in a hare, inside an iron chest, buried under a green oak tree - and devouring every last drop.

beers.name: White Street Belgian Blonde
beers.description: The White Street Belgian Blonde is a light Belgian ale with a crisp body and delicate white fruit and spice notes from Trappist yeast.

beers.name: White Street Belgian Dubbel
beers.description: The White Street Belgian Dubbel has a malt forward Belgian ale with an amber hue. Dark candi syrup adds notes of dark fruit and molasses alongside the spicy Trappist yeast.

beers.name: White Street Centennial IPA
beers.description: The White Street Centennial IPA is a single hop IPA that showcases the pungent aromatics of Centennial hops. Orange peel and fresh evergreen dominate the nose and are balanced by a crisp American malt character.

beers.name: White Street Kölsch
beers.description: White Street Kölsch pours an old-gold with a fine, white head. A subtle fruitiness for the nose extends to the palate with hints of pear and melon. A very crisp and refreshing thirst quencher.

beers.name: White Street Scottish Ale
beers.description: Pouring a deep mahogany, White Street Scottish Ale produces a tight tan head that gives way to a complex maltiness. Herbal and spicy notes play nicely in a caramel essence to produce a beautifully sessionable beer.

beers.name: Amorous - Royal Cache Barrel Reserve Series
Artist Formerly Known As...
beers.description: Purple rice and Indian Spices in memory of one of the most enigmatic artists of our time.

beers.name: Aye-Aye Stout
beers.description: A big roasty stout with wildflower honey

beers.name: Barrel-Aged Lunatic Blonde
beers.description: Blonde ale aged in a French oak foeder.

beers.name: Bedeviled Golden Strong Ale
beers.description: This classic Belgian golden strong ale clocks in at 8.4% abv. Gold in color and rich with spicy clove and bright fruit aromas, this ale is perfect for warm nights.

beers.name: Black Angel
beers.description: Ages ago, the nefarious Bacilli the Black resurfaced from darkness and infected the Great Angel of Light with an obsidian parasite. A great darkness took over the Angel as she shed her luminous spirit. No longer fit for the heavens, she was exiled to the Woods of Obscurity. With sustenance from the fruit of the wood, the Angel began to forge virtue from the evil that had infected her. After her long respite, she emerged from the wood with a profound new strength and cast Bacilli the Black back into great darkness. Now, known as the Black Angel, she spends her days between two worlds nourishing all who drink…

beers.name: Bombaldine
beers.description: Bombadile is a Brettanomyces farmhouse ale fermented with a half pound per gallon of ripe Florida strawberries and delicately aged in a French oak foeder.

beers.name: Brettaberry
beers.description: A tart farmhouse ale whose inspiration is drawn from freshly baked berry pie, features a half-pound per gallon of strawberries, blueberries, and blackberries. The sweet acidity of the berries paired with the mild farmhouse funk of our house culture is rounded by the addition of full bodied, Haw Creek honey.

beers.name: Bretticent Wild Ale
beers.description: This traditional saison is brewed using North Carolina grown barley, wheat, and rye from Riverbend Malthouse and is open fermented. The beer is then finished with Brettanomyces.

beers.name: CaliMost Gose
beers.description: Tart with local honey and grapefruit.

beers.name: Cardinal Sin Red
beers.description: Pouring Utah desert red, this Belgian ale was dry hopped with Styrian Golding hops which give a mandarin orange aroma to the spicy Belgian yeast. Flavors of cotton candy round out a balanced bready malt character.

beers.name: Coolcumber
beers.description: Inspired by a Hendrick’s gin basil cooler, Coolcumber is made with cucumber, basil, and juniper berries. Just like making a great cocktail, this beer is dosed carefully with its ingredients to create a one-of-a-kind flavor experience. Golden in color and wonderfully drinkable.

beers.name: Dark Age Bourbon Stout
beers.description: Few things pair together better than bourbon and beer. This imperial stout spends upwards of 6 months soaking up rich flavors of bourbon aging in oak barrels. With huge chocolate flavors playing together with awesome bourbon character and a warming finish, this beer is a great night capper.

beers.name: Dark Arts Imperial Stout (Aged In Tequila Barrels W/ Espresso)
Dark Arts Imperial Stout (Aged In Tequila Barrels)
Decoy Red
beers.description: This red ale is hit with a 21 pound blend of cascade, centennial, and chinook hops in the whirlpool, which is where beer receives most of its flavor and aroma structure. No dry hop here, but still expect loads of awesome hop flavor complimenting the malty rich flavors of caramel malts.

beers.name: Dirndl Bock
beers.description: Flavor & Aroma: Bready and chocolate malt charactor paired with earthy hops.

beers.name: Divergence
beers.description: This brettanomyces porter is made with dry fermented Ethiopian coffee from Mountain Air roasters. Although there is no fruit in this beer, there are amazing flavors of cherry and dark berries that meld seamlessly together with flavors of bourbon from the wood barrels.

beers.name: Don't Tread on Maize
beers.description: Brewed with all American hops, this beer is an American Pale Ale with the addition of flaked corn and cornflowers. Proceeds from this beer will be donated to the organization Veterans Helping Veterans, benefiting their Pints for Patriots campaign. Golden in color with corn characteristics, this brew makes helping others feel easy!

beers.name: El Paraiso Imperial Coffee Stout
beers.description:
Imperial Coffee Stout ale brewed with Coffee and Cocoa Nibs
Under cold winter skies we dream of warm summer paradise, of far off, floating islands where the awakening scents of roasted coffee and cocoa nibs restore our work worn souls. From our first sunrise sip of coffee to our last sunset sip of beer, El Paraiso is the muse of our work and our rest. Our ode to every brewer's belief that it takes a lot of good .. to make a great beer.

beers.name: Empyrean Barrel Aged DIPA
beers.description: This is a huge double IPA hopped with Columbus and El Dorado hops. After primary fermentation, this beer spent three months in fresh bourbon barrels. The result is a unique blend of citrus and lovely wood character.

beers.name: Framboos Morte
beers.description: This intensely red beer begins its life as Cosette Blonde Sour. We pick through our stock choosing 5-12 month old barrels and then blend onto 1.75 pounds per gallon of fresh NC grown raspberries where it re-ferments on the fruit for 2 months.

beers.name: Freak of Nature Double IPA
beers.description: The Freak of Nature is our San Francisco inspired hoppy monster. At 8% abv and who knows how many ibu’s, this beer is our shrine to the Hop. Absurd amounts of the big West Coast hops gives this beer its citrusy, weedy nose and big, dank flavor. We dry hop with 48lbs per batch, which is over 3lbs of hops per barrel. I keeping with the classic style of the West Coast double, sugar plays a large part in creating this dry and minimally bitter double IPA. The Freak is particularly pintable for the style, so if you dare to enter, we welcome you to the Freak Show.

beers.name: Freaky Friday DIPA
beers.description: We love hops at Wicked Weed. This Double IPA was brewed with some brand new and experimental hops from the American Dwarf Hop Association. Jarrylo, hop #484, and hop #871 create a hugely aromatic IPA.

beers.name: Garçon de Ferme
beers.description:
Brettanomyces Farmhouse Ale fermented with Peaches
Our craft honors our childhood lessons. We were lucky to learn ours the hard way: “stick with it,” “wipe your tears,” “Earn your calluses,” and “try to keep up with our ol’ man.” These are the lessons that stay, working their way into our weather flash and aching bones until they are as much a part of us as our own names.

Garçon de Ferme is a foeder-rested, Brettanomcyes farmhouse ale. After fermentation,this pleasantly tart ale is blended back onto over a pound and half per gallon of fresh, whole peaches to reflect and echo that the craft of the old has not been wasted on the young.

beers.name: Genesis Blonde Sour
beers.description: Genesis is one amazing beer. We fermented this beer with papaya, mango, guava and pineapple which leads to a huge tropical fruit character. This fruit explosion is balanced by a lactic tartness that was developed by aging in wine barrels for 7 months.

beers.name: Gluten FREEk
beers.description: Gluten FREEk is Asheville’s first gluten reduced beer. Crafted for those with a gluten intolerance who are sick of drinking beer that doesn’t taste like beer, Freek was brewed with loads of hops and a similar grain bill to Freak of Nature DIPA. This ale is designed to be big, hoppy, and uniquely Wicked Weed. Gluten FREEk contains less than 10ppm of gluten.

beers.name: Glutenous Minimus
beers.description: This IPA is the third gluten reduced beer we’ve brewed here at Wicked Weed. Its ripe melon aroma leads to a crisp, refreshing flavor balanced with notes of honey and malty sweetness. Trust me when I say, you won’t miss the gluten in this beer!

beers.name: Golden Angel
beers.description: Deep golden with a bright fruit haze and stone fruit tartness, this ale pulls inspiration from traditional Lambic fruits and showcases the depth and range of apricot flavors.

beers.name: Hefeweizen
beers.description: There is no Oktoberfest without Hefeweizen. Brewed with classic German ingredients, our take on this style is loaded with banana esters and hints of clove producing a flavorful and highly drinkable wheat beer.

beers.name: Heresy Brown Ale
beers.description: At 7.4% abv this is a dangerously drinkable beer (in a good way). The color is milk chocolate brown with a red hue. We use a considerable amount of chocolate and crystal malts to give this beer a rich malt flavor and we add a generous amount of American hops to give Heresy a Wicked punch. This ale is dry hopped, which is not traditional for this style, but we think it makes it downright tasty! This is the best pairing on our beer list for a burger. Delish!

beers.name: Hop Burglar IPA
beers.description: Brewed with blood orange purée and fresh grapefruit zest, this beer is unlike any other. The richness of blood oranges pairs nicely with the tart flavor of grapefruit and hops. We dry hopped this beer with Amarillo and other top secret hops. Why the name Hop Burglar? Level 5 clearance required for this information.

beers.name: Hop Cocoa
beers.description:
Ingredients: French Broad Chocolate cocoa nibs, dry hopped
Color: deep brown Style: porter
hoppy: 2.5 malty: 4 fruity: 0.5

beers.name: Horti-Glory
beers.description: A tart, farmhouse ale brewed with Riverbend Malt and fermented with our house culture of brettanomyces. The addition of seasonal elderflowers, hyssop, and honeysuckle transform the rustic house culture into a lovely floral brett saison.

beers.name: Incorangeible
beers.description: Lack of reform is responsible for some of our most memorable brews. Featuring bright aromas or orange zest, round notes of chocolate, and juicy flavors or citrus hop notes, Incorangeble is a non-conformist’s IPA. Hold your ground and raise your glass to the unapologetic.

beers.name: Indulgence - Royal Cache Barrel Reserve Series
Infidel Porter
beers.description: Porters were born in London and dubbed the working man’s ale. At 6.7% this ale gets loads of chocolate malt and wheat malt to build a rich chocolate flavor and silky smooth mouthfeel. Dark and balanced, this beer is a great pairing for a burger or steak.

beers.name: Juiceless IPA
beers.description:
Flavor & Aroma: Huge fruity aromatics, no fruit added
Color: golden Style: wheat IPA
Special notes: Collaboration with Creature Comforts Brewery

beers.name: Le Peche Blanc
beers.description: This Brettanomyces finished saison was brewed with peaches and apricots. After 8 months in wine barrels this beer is boasting huge complexity and a refreshing tart finish.

beers.name: Lieutenant Dank
beers.description:
Flavor & Aroma: Dank and Citrus balanced hops
Color: blonde Style: IPA
hoppy: 4 malty: 2 fruity: 1

beers.name: Lunatic Blonde
beers.description: Lunatic is our traditional Belgian blonde. We made this one for the entry level Belgian drinker. Clove spice and pear aromas meld with the soft body and subtle hop character to create a very easy going beer.

beers.name: Lusus Naturae
beers.description: Lusus Naturae is a dry, North Carolina Double IPA brewed with thoroughbred Riverbend Malt and 30 lbs of fresh-off-the vine Cascade wet hops from Echo View farms. It is dry hoped with over 3 lbs per barrel and finished with our house Brettanomyces strain. Drink this hoppy goodness fresh or lay it down to bring out the funk.

beers.name: Milk & Cookies
beers.description: Milk &Cookies Stout transports us to our childhood kitchens where freshly baked cinnamon-raisin cookies warmed us against winter nights and familiar grandparent voices permeate the sounds of the night. Hints of cold milk, sweet vanilla, and hearty oatmeal overwhelm and remind us that our memories are forever lead by our senses. In this case, we are led home.

beers.name: Mint Julep
beers.description: Part of our cocktail series of beers, this brew is inspired by the ‘unofficial official’ drink of the Kentucky Derby. This ale is amber in color with malty flavors up front and a pleasant minty finish.

beers.name: Montmartre
beers.description: Next in our Canvas Series is Montmaretto. This Barrel-Aged American Sour undergoes secondary fermentation on a pound-per-gallon of Montmorency Cherries. A portion of this beer was also aged in barrels with almonds to impart an Amaretto character to the final blend.

beers.name: Moogfest Chocolate IPA
beers.description: Moog synthesizers asked us to brew a special beer to be the official ale of the 2014 Moogfest. We wanted to create something as unique as their product so we thought we would do a Chocolate IPA. We brewed with 50lbs of French Broad Chocolate Factory cocoa nibs, but we didn’t stop there… the Moog people sent us the wood of an actual Moog synthesizer and we aged this beer on it. This woody, chocolaty, hopped up Double IPA is awesome, just like Moog!

beers.name: Mosaic Saison
beers.description: Mosaic hops got their name because they tend to showcase an array of flavors depending on the beer they go into. In this saison, the hop flavors change every sip you take, from melon to pine, orange peel to lemon zest, this is one lovely ale.

beers.name: Napoleon Complex
beers.description: Napoleon Complex is a small-statured pale ale with a larger-than-life attitude. Ignoring the industry standard of diminutive hop presence and mild manner, this pale ale will have most IPA’s contemplating their inadequacy. Little beer, big flavor, even bigger ego.

beers.name: Nectarphillia
beers.description: Description

beers.name: Oblivion Sour Red
beers.description: Oblivion is a Sour Red ale that is aged with blackberries and dates in red wine barrels for up to 12 months. The beer is then carefully blended to create depth and balance that will envelope you in its complexity.

beers.name: Oh My Quad
beers.description: Belgian quadrupels are a prized beer. This open-fermented quad is full of rich dried fruit and toffee-like flavors, perfect for pairing with fine cheeses and gamey meats.

beers.name: Old Fashioned
beers.description: This ale pays homage to the iconic whiskey cocktail. We brewed this 9% ale with sweet cherries and orange zest then aged it in Whiskey barrels for 4 months to capture the essence of an Old Fashioned. Rich bourbon and soft cherry notes roll into a warming finish in this fantastic ale.

beers.name: Orange Peel Pale Ale
beers.description: Brewed for our next door neighbors at the Orange Peel Social Aid and Pleasure Club, this citrus forward brew boasts aromas and flavors of mandarin oranges, lemon peel and grapefruit. The addition of tangy hops and sweet orange peel creates a juicy pale ale that will speak to your palate the way good music speaks to your soul.

beers.name: Pernicious IPA
beers.description: Pernicious is our flagship India Pale Ale. With minimum malt complexity, we dry hop this beer with nearly twice the normal amount of hops typical to this style. The combination of juicy, tropical fruit-forward hops with heavy, resinous American hops is the epitome of a West Coast IPA, made right here in the Southeast.

beers.name: Pick Me! Pale Ale: Walt's Pick
Points Unknown IPA
beers.description: It seemed no single beer could adequately convey the collective talents of Portland, Oregon brewing legend and Ecliptic Brewing founder John Harris; Luke and Walt Dickinson, the brewmaster duo behind North Carolina’s Wicked Weed Brewing; and Stone Brewmaster Mitch Steele. So, this veritable triad of power opted to brew TWO beers. The first was a traditional Belgian-style tripel aged four months in oak barrels that originally housed red wine, then tequila. It was then blended at a one-fourth to three-fourths ratio with a freshly brewed West Coast double IPA to create this beer. A variety of diverse flavors coalesce into something more unique than any one beer our trio could have conceived.

beers.name: Red Angel
beers.description:
As the name indicates, this vibrant, blood red sour ale received 1.5 pounds of fresh raspberries per gallon and was then carefully aged in red wine barrels for nine months. After this barrel-ageing period, the beer was blended onto another pound of raspberries per gallon totaling one ton of raspberries and eleven months of ageing. 

We took inspiration from the clean side practices of dry-hoping IPA’s and added fresh fruit late in the aging process. The result is a full complexity of core fruit flavors with bright fruit character.

beers.name: Resonare
beers.description:
Barrel-aged American Sour Ale Fermented with Plums
Resonare is a golden sour ale aged in neutral wine barrels. Two pounds per gallon of whole Italian plums contribute depth of character and stone fruit essence to this sour ale. Once this beer reaches its peak, we blend the barrels to attain the perfect resonance of our house sour culture with rustic Italian plums.

beers.name: Reticent Saison
beers.description: This is our house saison made in the tradition of the farmhouses in Belgium. We ferment this ale in our open fermenation room to allow the saison yeast to create as much flavor as possible. Reticent is brewed with oats giving a silky mouthfeel, rye adding a slight spicy character and all noble hops making this an extremely authentic saison.

beers.name: Reverence
beers.description: This beer is made in reverence of Orval trappist ale. Brewed as a Belgian pale ale, then finished with Brettanomyces and aged in Cabernet barrels for 6 months. After the aging, we blended the beer and dry-hopped it with traditional Belgian hops to accentuate the floral character of the beer.

beers.name: Sauvage Wine Barrel Saison
beers.description: This saison was brewed to mimic Sauvignon Blanc wine. We brewed it with Nelson Sauvin hops which are grown in New Zealand and showcase grapefruit peel and grapy aromas, then aged the beer in Sauvignon Blanc wine barrels for 2 months.

beers.name: Serenity Wild Ale
beers.description: Serenity is our aptly named 100% Brettanomyces fermented beer. We are one of only a handful of breweries in the US doing 100% Bretta fermentation. That said, for our first one we wanted to do it in the farmhouse style that bretta entered the Belgian brewing world. Serenity is light in color with a subtle golden haze, the nose bursts of white grape, mango, pineapple and old leather. The flavors are similar to those found in New Zealand white wines and notes of guava and grape skin stand out leading to a well-rounded finish.

beers.name: Sir Ryan the Pounder
beers.description: Sir Ryan the Pounder is an American session ale. Its bready malt character is balanced with bright Centennial and Falconer’s Flight hops making this beer exceptionally drinkable. This ale was made to enjoy with friends in pints or pitchers, so pull up a stool and cheers to Sir Ryan.

beers.name: Super Flare
beers.description: Subtle notes of funk are brought out by the curry while the jalapeno focuses the palate on the hops.

beers.name: Sweet Talker IPA
beers.description: Low in alcohol, High in flavor. That was the goal in creating this super session beer. We used body building malts and some of our favorite hops to create a full flavored hop forward beer. We highly recommend sharing a pitcher of this beer with a friend.

beers.name: Terra Locale Appalachia
beers.description: Appalachia is a brett saison, brewed with sweet potatoes, honey and grits. The Terra Locale series focuses on using local ingredients.

beers.name: Tyranny Hoppy Red Ale
beers.description: Tyranny is absolute power vested in a single ruler. The Red India Pale Ale commands all authority, relegated in unflinching decrees of dank, resinous hops and the absolute foundation of crimson and crystal malts. balanced unlike any ruler before, there is no chink in its hop-fortified armor. Surrender to the Tyranny is unconditional.

beers.name: Tyrant Double Red
beers.description: The big brother of our Tyranny Red Ale, this heavily dry-hopped ale is a delicious creation. Tyrant is full of malt rich flavors backed up with deep pine, herb and grapefruit peel aromas, all around a hop heads dream. This is a big, bad beer that drinks a little too easy for the 8.5% abv. Pair with fish n’ chips and attitude.

beers.name: Watermelon Saison
beers.description: This 4.7% ABV saison is brewed with watermelon and is the perfect way to take the sting out of the summer heat.

beers.name: White Angel
beers.description: WHITE ANGEL is an American Sour Ale blended with two pounds per gallon of locally harvested Muscadine and Scuppernong grapes and aged in white wine barrels. Alter eight months, another pound per gallon of Amarillo wine must is blended in stainless steel tanks for 2 months. A total of 2.5 tons of fruit and 10 total months of maturation later we give you White Angel.

beers.name: Wicked City
beers.description: Brewed in collaboration with Holy City Brewing in Charleston, this beer was made with their local Brain Strain hot peppers and habaneros. A complex malt character backed by a mild heat makes this imperial stout dangerously drinkable.

beers.name: XII Peach Habanero Saison
beers.description: Hot peppers are a touchy fruit and can easily overwhelm a beer. We gently steeped habanero peppers into this saison and match them with 150 pounds of peach puree to create a balanced pepper-fruit beer. With heat in the aroma, peach on the palette, and a slight warming of the throat to finish, this ale will keep you wanting more.

beers.name: XXXI Saison
beers.description: This is the 31st variation of saison we have brewed at Wicked Weed. XXXI showcases the complexity of a saison style beer. We used crystal rye malt in tandem with subtle amounts of Pineapple and Mango creating a wonderful blend of earth like malt and tropical flavors.

beers.name: Happy Top Wheat
beers.description: Gentle, Cheerful, Luscious

beers.name: Leatherwood Red
beers.description: Fruit with Toast

beers.name: Wildcat Pale Ale
beers.description: Citrus, Exotic

beers.name: Baba Budan Coffee IPA
beers.description: This Coffee IPA is a collaboration with Fonta Flora brewery in Morganton, NC. We took a West-coast style IPA and infused it with 80 lbs of locally roasted coffee from Espresso News in Boone. It's a delicious mix of roasted and citrus aromas in a beer that will delight drinkers of both.

beers.name: Black Gold
beers.description: Like Daniel Boone, this AMB flagship is a legend in the High Country. This brown porter is overflowing with dark aromas and has a creamy, persistent, tan head. Delve deeper and you will find a perfect balance between traditional English hops and the complex malt flavors, with a smooth balance between chocolate and coffee. You may not always drink gold, but when you do make sure it’s Black Gold.

beers.name: Daniel's Double
beers.description: Just as Daniel was adventurous, this double is named after his pioneering spirit. It has a citrus hop bomb in the nose and a massive, resinous hop flavor. And despite the 9% ABV, this is one crushable double IPA.

beers.name: Honey Badger
beers.description: An ode to the American Blonde, this award-winning light bodied ale is a beer for all seasons. The Honey Badger is brewed with orange zest to add additional citrus notes to complement the light hop aroma. The clean and crisp mouthfeel is followed by just a hint of sweetness from local North Carolina wildflower honey. While best enjoyed by a cool mountain river in the summer, this blonde is delicious no matter where, no matter when. You could say a Honey Badger doesn’t give a …

beers.name: Hoppy Snazzy Fresh Nitro
beers.description: Traditionally nitro beers are dark and malty. This spring nitro pale ale casts off tradition and the dark of winter by drawing in the fresh and light aromas of spring. Pairing rich, fruity aromas and hop flavor with creamy nitro mouthfeel makes this ale disappear from your glass faster than winter's chill.

beers.name: Leave No Trace IPA
beers.description: Leave No Trace is a motto that we intend to abide by in all facets of our lives. That includes packing out everything you pack into the scenic local mountains AND finishing every last drop of this citrusy well-balanced India Pale Ale.

beers.name: Long Leaf
beers.description: Taking its name from the toast of the Old North State, this amber IPA cheers with a white head, citrus aroma, and an intense, resins hop flavor that will linger on your palate.

beers.name: Mystic Dragon Cider
beers.description: This apple based cider is infused with green tea, rhubarb, and strawberries to give it a mysterious sweetness while drying it out slightly. Its a perfect compliment to spicy foods.

beers.name: Nilla Hay-Fa
beers.description: Nitro Pale Ale

beers.name: No Rye’me, No Reason
beers.description: Our rendition of a light Pale Ale with a hardy hop-backbone. Brewers tend to have a lot of grain sitting around, and without much reason at all a pinch of rye ended up in the mash-ton. An intuitive leap at the time, that landed with just a hint of spice.

beers.name: Saison V-10
beers.description: Tart, dry-hopped saison.

beers.name: Switchback AMBer
beers.description: Inspired by all of the straight roads and trails of the High Country. The trail might seem longer and more difficult to navigate, but to the seasoned vet, switchbacks save years on your knees. This crisp, classic amber ale has a complex malty backbone, complemented by a mild hop character.

beers.name: The Blonde AMBition
beers.description: If there was a “Gateway” beer to convert all of the American Lager Lovers of the High Country to drink craft beer, this is it. You may call us naive for believing that everyone will stop drinking the “buds” and start drinking our craft brew. But we will just pour you a glass of this crisp, refreshing blonde ale and hope our ambition will overcome.

beers.name: 5506' Pale Ale
beers.description: Our 5506' Pale Ale is a full-bodied American ale that's golden in color. The malty sweetness of the mash is offset by a generous amount of Magnum and Northern Brewer bittering hops. The hop bursting technique of late addition cascade hops contribute a delightful citrus/floral note that will lighten anybody's spirits. A great beer with a lot of altitude!

beers.name: Cream Ale
beers.description: Our Liberty Ale is a light session ale designed for afternoons that you decide you would rather sit in the lodge than boogie down the slopes. Using a Cream Ale yeast blend, it delivers a crisp, clean, easy-drinking light hybrid beer with characteristics of both an ale and a lager. The Liberty hops provide a subtle spicy/sweet aroma. Get liberated!!

beers.name: Yardsale Ale
beers.description: This Scotch Ale is fantastic ale for cooler weather. It delivers a wonderful complexity of malty notes with balanced hop character achieved through the noble Fuggle hops. It goes down far too easily for an 8.1 % ABV beer! If you wipe out on the slopes and someone yells “Yard Sale”, this ale might be to blame.

beers.name: Amber Blaze
beers.description: This is our take on the classic American Amber. Amber Blaze Amber will remind you of the first craft beer you ever fell in love with turned up to 11. We push the classic style with a biscuit-forward maltiness and generous hop flavor and aroma.

beers.name: Black Blaze Milk Stout
beers.description: Our milk stout is an old, classic English mainstay. Black Blaze is a lighter-bodied, creamy dark beer. It has a slightly sweetened roastiness with hints of espresso & chocolate. This is a dark beer that you can drink all day long. In fact, I'm drinking one right now.

beers.name: Blue Blaze Altbier
beers.description: We have taken two very different classic German Altbier styles and crafted them into one refreshing, crisp, lighter-bodied beer that still packs in the flavor. The deep copper maltiness contrasts with the bright white head and spicy finish.

beers.name: Double Blaze Black IPA
beers.description: We love brewing complex beers that blend two classic styles, transcending both to form something unique and delicious. In this case, we've introduced Porter and IPA, resulting in a beautiful balance of citrus hop flavors and tropical aromas, packed tightly into a medium‐body dark ale with a roasty finish.

beers.name: Sherpa Winter Porter
beers.description: Sherpa Winter Porter is a light-bodied dark Brown Porter with very light hop flavor and aroma. We’ve introduced notes of your favorite winter tastes: Vanilla, cinnamon nutmeg, tiramisu, and hazelnut along with light sweetness, caramel and chocolate.

beers.name: Yellow Blazer Kölsch
beers.description: This classic German golden ale is crisp and satisfying. The mild, sweet malt is perfectly balanced with a subdued spicy flavor note from German hops.

beers.name: Blueberry Coffee Porter
beers.description: Classic English style Brown Porter with roasty cold brewed coffee and a subtle touch of blueberry.

beers.name: Raspberry Saison
beers.description: Tart raspberries and spicy French/Belgian Saison yeast combine to create this surprisingly complex and refreshingly crisp farmhouse style ale.

beers.name: Bolo Coconut Brown
beers.description: The cleaver’s blade is strong enough and sharp enough to crack the toughest of coconuts. Easy drinking without lacking flavor, the addition of coconut is the perfect compliment to the subtle sweetness and nutty undertones present from the specialty malts.

beers.name: Haysaw Saison
beers.description: Used for centuries on the farm as a tool to cut through bales of hay, this saw has a decidedly demonic figure. Inspired by Burial’s future as a farmhouse brewery, this Belgian farmhouse ale is deceivingly complex. pale, wheat and Belgian crystal malts are combined to forge a wonderfully well-rounded beer, while wide bodied slow fermentation of our house saison yeast imparts plum and clove flavors.

beers.name: Pipehawk Mountain Ale
beers.description: A sessionable IPA brewed with a single malt and hopped up with Citra, Amarillo and Simcoe hops. Easy drinking with a burst of citrusy hops.

beers.name: Prismatic Eye
beers.description: A Double IPA brewed with Other Half Brewing from Brooklyn. Our type of people. Our type of ritual. NC-grown six-row grain under a bouquet of Citra, Summer, and Centennial hops. Fermented with our house yeast blend.

beers.name: Scythe Rye India Pale Ale
beers.description: An aggressive harvest tool with a dynamic history, the scythe is traditionally used for harvesting crops. But it was adopted by the lower class as an implement of death during times of war and protest. Our Rye India Pale Ale also has a dual nature with the nose of your traditional IPA and the incredible malt complexity of your European pale ale.  We use a healthy dose of malted Rye and Belgian Crystal malts while Summit and Chinook hops add that delicious hop flavor and the exclusive addition of Mosaic in the whirlpool and dry hop adds a profoundly unique blueberry and pineapple aroma.

beers.name: Skillet Donut Stout
beers.description: The perfect beer for your morning– a cup of coffee and a chocolate-glazed donut. Just like a well-seasoned skillet, this beer has all the right flavors-thanks to a healthy dose of Nugget hops and milk sugar, 6-row Pale malt from Riverbend Malt House and a 50/50 blend of cold pressed Hologram and Big Trouble coffees from Counter Culture Coffee.

beers.name: Spoon Oatmeal Pale Ale
beers.description: Unearthed from bed, I arise to a blanket of snow. The only comfort from the bitterness outside and the heavy work load ahead – my breakfast. As I grab my spoon, I head looking for a hearty bowl of oats, topped with fresh pear and apple. So we used a hefty dose of flaked oats and calypso hops to fill you up. At 6.3% and a much lower bitterness than our other hoppy beers, you’ll find a smooth, full bodied American pale with a sharp, almost piney, fruit flavor.

beers.name: Surf Wax IPA
beers.description: Forget the cold, go grab your wax and coat that board. Where we come from, the waves are best in the winter. So this isn’t your SoCal treat – it’s a NW surfer’s delight. Simply made with Golden Promise and Crystal 120, this all seasons IPA is packed with copious amounts of Nelson Sauvin and Columbus to provide a heady, danky bite. We then dry hopped with more than 2lbs/bbl to give it a more robust aroma. Get stoked. Surf’s up.

beers.name: Voorhamer Imperial Stout
beers.description: The Dutch equivalent of the sledge hammer, Voorhamer’s large metal head can apply significantly more force than other hammers. Although this Imperial Stout is our biggest, boldest beer, it maintains a warm silky smooth balance.  A blend of different roasted malts, oats, and cherrywood smoked barley are combined with molasses sugar and milk sugars throughout a long and healthy boil. Add to that more than 90IBUs fueled by Nugget hops. While it’s great on its own, we often blend coffee and wood to add extra layers of complexity.

beers.name: All Mountain (Mint Chocolate Milk Stout)
beers.description: Fresh mint, chocolate, oats, and lactose: what a combination!! This medium bodied milk stout gets a good amount of oats in the mash and lactose in the boil to add creaminess to this stout.  Fresh mint is also added into the boil to give zip to the All Mountain. Finally, we add Videri cocoa nibs post fermentation to round out this beauty, which might just transport you to the Andes!

beers.name: Barley Wine
beers.description: Aged in cognac, Spanish rum and bourbon barrels and blended after aging.

beers.name: Beetaway
beers.description: Beet Saison

beers.name: Beta-Way
beers.description: Belgian Saison with Carrots

beers.name: Big Wheel
beers.description: Brown Ale

beers.name: Crank Away
beers.description: Cranberry Saison

beers.name: Eat Sleep Bike E.S.B.
beers.description: This seasonal English ale is as traditional as they come. A medium bodied Extra Special Bitter has a good portion of crystal malt for a slight caramel flavor along with English East Kent Goldings hops. Cheers mate!

beers.name: Flying Scotsman
beers.description: Traditional 90 schilling Scottish Ale. This deep copper-brown ale is very malt forward with a touch of roasted barley and smoked malt with a medium body. Slainte Mhor!

beers.name: Holy Mole
beers.description: Inspired by traditional Mexican mole sauce, this Porter is unique. We start with a medium bodied smoked Porter but we take it up a notch post fermentation. At this point we add habanero peppers and cocoa nibs from our neighbor at Videri Chocolate Factory. Can you take the heat?

beers.name: Holy Mole Smoke Porter
beers.description: Inspired by traditional Mexican mole sauce, this Porter is unique. We start with a medium bodied smoked Porter but we take it up a notch post fermentation. At this point we add habanero peppers and cocoa nibs from our neighbor at Videri Chocolate Factory. Can you take the heat?

beers.name: Hopaway
beers.description: Hoppy Belgian Saison

beers.name: Icycle Belgian Brown Ale
beers.description: A medium bodied, low hop character ale with added ginger, orange zest and cardamom.

beers.name: Motivator
beers.description: A medium-bodied imperial oatmeal stout with locally sourced Videri cocoa nibs and Café de los Muertos dark roast coffee added post fermentation. Great for breakfast, dessert, or anytime!

beers.name: Motivator Stout
beers.description: A medium-bodied imperial oatmeal stout with locally sourced Videri cocoa nibs and Benelux dark roast coffee added post fermentation. Great for breakfast, dessert, or anytime!

beers.name: Reflector Red
beers.description: A medium-bodied Irish red ale. Very low hop profile allows this malt-forward ale to shine through with its caramel and roasty flavor. Slainte!

beers.name: Rickshaw Rye IPA
beers.description: This American Style IPA get a 24% dose of spicy rye malt to add complexity. In addition we use American variety Zythos blend and Nugget hops to give a unique flavor and aroma. Take a ride today!

beers.name: Rydeaway
beers.description: Traditional Belgian Style Saison made with 34% rye malt.

beers.name: Unicycle Single Hop Pale Ale
beers.description: This crisp American Style Pale Ale is meant to be both enjoyable and educational (to your palate). The malt and hop bill will stay constant during the year with one catch: Each time we brew we will feature a different hop for bittering, flavor, aroma, and dry hopping. This will let you taste the uniqueness of each hop.

beers.name: Uphill Climb
beers.description: Belgian Golden Ale with a medium body and smooth finish. High fermentation temperature produced a lot of esters in this ale, which results in fruity flavors from the yeast.

beers.name: White Wall Wit
beers.description: A new take on a Belgian classic. While we do use traditional wheat malt and Belgian yeast typical of Wit style beers we derive the citrus aroma and flavor not from spices, but instead from Falconer's Flight hops. Light and crisp, this one will have you wanting more.

beers.name: Brown Sugar Brown Cow
beers.description:
This Mocha Brown ale needed a fanatical bovine with a brown sugar sweet side and a kick of Colombian coffee. Brown Sugar Brown Cow is brewed
with chocolate, vanilla, brown sugar and Colombian coffee. We added a hint of lactose, and this brew is a mocha coffee and cream concoction so good you’ll say its name.

beers.name: Flight
beers.description: Honey Altbier

beers.name: Kitty Hawk
beers.description: Honey Altbier

beers.name: Systema Naturae
beers.description: Systema Naturae (System of Nature) is an exploration of scientific processes and ingredients exhibited throughout the natural world. This addition to the series, Devilwood & Apricots, blends the sweet aroma of Devilwood Blossoms with the musk and tartness of Apricots. Fermented with wild lactobacillus and wild yeast. Naturally conditioned.

beers.name: Viking Fraoch
beers.description: Viking Fraoch Scottish Sour is the first Fanatical Ale in our Ancient Sour Series. Viking Fraoch (Fraoch is Scandinavian for Heather, a flower native to that area) is a 4,000 year old Viking Heather Flower Ale combined with an 18th Century Scottish Ale that is spontaneously soured with a rich brown hue, balanced tartness and hint of heather flowers. Flavors of caramel, bold tartness and ripe stone fruit give way to lingering flowers and clean, crisp mouthfeel.

beers.name: Whiskers On Kittens
beers.description: Blonde Sour- Spontaneous sour with a crisp blond hue, balanced tartness and hint of roses. Flavors of white grape bold tartness and ripe stone fruit give way to lingering flowers and clean, crisp mouth-feel.

beers.name: 4042 Stout
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's 4042 stout is a sweet stout brewed with generous amounts of freshly ground cocoa, chocolate malt and cocoa nibs from local North Carolina chocolatiers.

beers.name: Backcountry Black IPA
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's Backcountry Black IPA is an Imperial Pale Ale that is hopped up with 6 unique hop varieties that blends nicely with its slightly roasty malt backbone.

beers.name: Collaboration Without Representation
beers.description: Brewed in Collaboration with Bottle Revolution.  Bourbon barrel aged imperial chocolate milk stout with coffee

beers.name: Double D's Watermelon Lager
beers.description:
Deep River Brewing Company's Double D's Watermelon Lager is a bright crisp lager that has a hint of fresh Johnston County watermelon infused flavor that is perfect for those hot North Carolina days. This refreshing brew is named after the owner's fathers who are both named 'Don' and are both fans of traditional lager style beers. 

1st Place Winner in the 2011 Piedmont Brewer's Cup for Fruit Beer.

beers.name: JoCo White Winter
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's JoCo White Winter is a seasonal beer that is brewed with fresh Johnston County white sweet potatoes, toasted marshmallows, and a blend of spices. This is a... challenge (PAIN) to brew (think marshmallows stuck in your hair) but it's worth it because it's one of our favorite to drink.

beers.name: Oxbow IPA
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's Oxbow IPA is a light bodied full flavor IPA that has a rotating hop profile.

beers.name: Riverbank Rye-It
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's Riverbank Rye-It IPA is a amber pale ale, with subtle hints of rye and citrus. The spicy notes imparted by the rye thread together nicely with the citrusy aromas of Columbus hops.

beers.name: Twisted River Wit
beers.description: Deep River Brewing Company's Twisted River Wit is a full flavor Belgian Witbier with hints of orange and citrus notes weaved with a Belgian yeast strain, and hopped with Cascade.

beers.name: Abby's Amber Ale
beers.description:
A dark copper, medium bodied beer with a nice malt balance.  Maris Otter and Crystal malts give this beer a rich character while not being overly malty.  A great session beer, at least how Double Barley defines a session beer!

The Story: Abby’s amber came into creation quite simply I would say. Our BFFs daughter, Abby, was at the Lane nutshack one afternoon and was talking to Larry about beer, as she often would. When she heard about my Wilma’s Wandering EyePA she was instantly jealous and looked at Larry and stated matter of fact that she wanted a beer named after her. Now I know that this seems ordinary but you have to know that Abby was 9 years old at the time. She is no ordinary child either as she is an amazing musician, teaching herself the guitar and piano at the age of 6. She intends to celebrate her 21st birthday with a pint of Abby’s Amber Ale which is no ordinary amber. Abby has to wait but you fortunately are able to partake and she will have to live vicariously through you!

beers.name: Black Chicken Brown Cow
beers.description: BBA with cocoa nibs and orange peel

beers.name: Double Dubbel
beers.description:
A classic Belgian Dubbel brewed with Belgian Pilsen, Munich and wheat malts along with the darkest candi syrup. Fermented with a Belgian yeast strain, starting at a lower than typical temperature, creating subtle classic Belgian phenols without overwhelming.

The DD Story: Double Dubbel pays homage to trappist monks…and, well, “monk Larry.” The addition of dark homemade candi syrup during high krausen lends subtle undertones of plum. Like a mad scientist concocting experiments, Larry spent his first five brewing years in his garage adding this and that ingredient until the masterpiece was made. You’d never believe this beer was created by Larry in his garage and not by monks in Belgium. Congrats Larry for entering monkhood!

beers.name: Fat Charley’s Raspberry Chocolate Stout
beers.description:
A surprisingly smooth and easy to drink Imperial Stout with a wonderful raspberry flavor followed by a hint of chocolate. Aged on organic cocoa nibs, this beer is mildly carbonated with a creamy thick head. Try pouring it over homemade vanilla ice cream!

The Scoop: This beer was the brain child of our dear friend, Charley. We were hanging out in the garage (yes, it’s a common theme), bouncing around ideas for new beers when the light bulb went off in Charley’s head.  She jumped out of her chair making a grand proclamation that a raspberry chocolate stout would be phenomenal. We went with her idea because she has great taste. Turns out…she was right! This brew rocks, tasting like a dark chocolate raspberry truffle in a glass! Thanks Charley!

beers.name: FFF Holiday Ale
beers.description:
The perfect beer to take your mind off all the family fun over the holidays! A beautiful, deep amber color, with medium body and a thick, creamy head. Nicely spiced but subtle, finishing a bit warm – perfect for those cold winter nights!

The Story: FFF Holiday Ale was recently renamed after years of calling it Winter Warmer. We’ve have had this private joke between our friends where we claim to have FFF. FFF stands for Family F@#*ing Fun! This is the forced fun we are talking about, not the genuine fleeting moment family fun.

We feel it is necessary to have a few FFF Holiday ales before any family arrives. This will set you right and you will overlook all the annoying things your family does. FFF Holiday Ale embodies the essence of family at the holidays so here is wishing you and yours some FFF!

beers.name: Field of Dreams Peaches and Cream
Revelation Pale Ale
beers.description:
A full-flavored pale ale, golden orange in color with slight citrus notes. Light bodied for easy drinking.  The nose brings a slight hint of orange blossom honey.

The Story: This is our version of the perfect introduction to craft beer.  It’s name comes from that moment in which you have a revelation that you will forever be a craft beer drinker.  We have “saved” many friends and continue to lead people to the altar.  Although it was designed for greenhorns, this pale ale has passes the muster for any beersnob!  Enjoy!

beers.name: Richard's Black EyePA
beers.description:
Double Black India Pale Ale with a delicious malt backbone of dark roasted coffee and rich cocoa.  44 lbs. of hops provide essences of citrus, lemongrass and pine punctuated with a lovely hop bitterness on the finish.

The Story:

The thrill of victory, the agony of defeat – and a juicy black eye to show for it! The game was Ping Pong – a heated doubles match in the brewhouse. Richard’s partner, Brewer Mark hits it and steps back, Richard steps forward at the same time – POW! Black eye #1. Fast forward to yet another riveting match, Richard’s opponent decides to use a golf ball in lieu of the correct and much lighter ball. The golf ball takes a hop in the wrong direction and KAPOW! Black eye #2(same one!)

To honor Richard’s brave heart and tenacity, we brewed this flavorful Double Black Eye PA! Unlike Richard, this beer has a nice bitter end to remind you that haters should be your motivators!!

beers.name: Sexy Rexy Red Rye
beers.description:
Crisp rye ale with a deep red color.  Brewed with 25% malted rye, this beer is a slightly spicy, very drinkable brew.

The Sexy Story: Sexy Rexy Red Rye is named in honor of Cheryl’s dad.  Nicknamed Sexy Rexy, Cheryl’s dad introduced her to beer for the first time.  He had a beer collection of hundreds of empty cans on custom shelves above the couch in his den – pretty classy! Rex was “old school” and loved him a red snapper.  Before he died, Cheryl was in the process of converting him to craft beer. Sexy Rexy Red Rye is smooth and charming, and a bit spicy, just like Rex.  This was brewed with the beach in mind, his favorite place!

beers.name: Sparkky’s Coffee Chocolate Milk Stout
beers.description:
A super smooth beer with a variety of dark roasted malts, cold brewed coffee and chocolate lending to the complex flavors.  A creamy, clean finish gives no indication of the lofty ABV! Instead of being a pork chop in a can, it’s more like tiramisu in a glass!

The Story: Our good buddy, Sparky, with whom we often trek into the woods to listen to music, requested a coffee chocolate stout as payment for a solid pecan pig chopping board he made for Larry. Sparky is an amazing woodworker, among other things, and delivered the coolest pig chopping board ever made! This beer was designed to be as interesting as our friend and can be enjoyed in many venues. Of course, it can be a breakfast or dessert beer but we like to drink it in front of  a bonfire while listening to our favorite local bands and doing a little Sparky jig.

beers.name: Steak Cake Stout
beers.description:
Surprisingly smooth and easy to drink with little bitterness.  Balanced with roasted flavors, hops and malt.  Pours a brown, creamy head that stays throughout the drink.  Mildly carbonated, lending to the smoothness.

The Story: SteakCake Stout is our base stout that can be enjoyed with a variety of foods.  There is a battle in our family that lead to the name.  Larry, the sweet tooth, prefers to pair this beer with a sweet treat.  While, Cheryl, the carnivore, insists that is pairs best with a big, juicy porterhouse steak.  We are confident that you will like this stout, so try it with both and decide for yourself!

beers.name: Thrilla in Vanilla Porter
beers.description:
A smooth, medium bodied beer with distinct bourbon-soaked vanilla-bean flavoring. Slight sweetness balanced nicely with malt bitterness. Pours a tan head that tastes like vanilla whipped cream.

Thrilla’s Story: One of our oldest friends reviewed the business plan and had only two suggestions (1) include finger puppets of ourselves in the business plan and (2) rename the vanilla porter. We took both very seriously and immediately put them into action. Little did we know that brainstorming would lead us to the epic fight in Manila. We loved the name Thrilla’ in Vanilla’ and what really cemented it for us was picturing vanilla beans duking it out! Trust us, this beer is knock out!

beers.name: Wilma's Wandering EyePA
beers.description:
A very drinkable Super Imperial IPA.  Pronounced but nicely balanced hop profile. Pours amber red, with a thick white head.  Subtle notes of orange are present but fade quickly.

Her Story: The story of Wilma’s Wandering EyePA begins at home at the Lane house. As a hophead, Cheryl insisted that Larry create an Imperial IPA with a slight floral nose and boy did she get it! This beer is so drinkable that it’s easy to forget about its high ABV . . . which leads to the name! Tread lightly or you too could end up with a wandering eye.

beers.name: Hop Beard
beers.description: A classic west coast style IPA. Bright and hoppy, this is one of our most popular beers.

beers.name: 2013 Holiday IPA
beers.description: American Style IPA using a roasted Malt for darker color.  Added Honey, Orange and Cinnamon for the Holidays

beers.name: LFD (Sharks In Me Collards)
beers.description: Orange Flower Honey Blossom touch with a light and crisp flavor.  Be Careful it is easy to drink

beers.name: Wild Flower Honey Wheat
beers.description: Light Wheat Flavor with a touch of chamomile and orange blossom.  Great Lawn mower Beer

beers.name: Alternating Current
beers.description: Gizmo Brew Works ushers in autumn with its newest seasonal, an altbier. Brewed true to the German style, this crisp amber ale is malt-forward, exhibiting a sweet caramel flavor accentuated by a light touch of spicy Noble hops.

beers.name: Bee Keeper
beers.description: A light, dry, refreshing summer ale. Hints of banana and bread on the nose. A clean finish highlighted by a touch of cloves and subtle honey flavor. Very low in bitterness.

beers.name: Beekeeper Honey Wheat
beers.description: Beekeeper Honey Wheat exhibits the characteristics of honey sweetness, floral nose, fruity flavors, a hint of clove, with a light body. Brewed with wildflower honey, Gizmo’s honey wheat beer is a nod to the beekeeping profession. Due to popular demand, this once summer favorite is now available year round.

beers.name: Black Hop Down
