beers.description: West coast hops make a covert entry into our new winter seasonal.  Disguised in a dark cloak of Midnight Wheat, this India Black Ale packs 71 IBUs.  Centennial, Columbus, Chinook, Comet, and Amarillo stealthily assume their position on the field of battle.  Survival is unlikely… escaping this darkness is impossible.

beers.name: Black Stiletto Stout
beers.description: A sexy, silky stout. Aroma recalls roasted barley and caramel. A smooth body on the lighter side for a stout. Enjoyable mouthfeel. Finishes on the sweeter side with noticeable chocolate flavor. Try with spicy foods, red meats, fruit-based desserts, and anything containing chocolate.

beers.name: Born Again Brown
beers.description:
Rising from the ashes of a fallen brewery, Gizmo Brew Works forges its own path in the craft beer scene.  This seasonal one-off pays homage to our predecessors, who brewed a gone-but-not-forgotten porter way back at the turn of the decade.
A tosty malt bill of 2-row, biscuit, chocolate, and caramel malts accentuate a delicate blend of cinnamon and honey flavors. At a mere 5.4%,Born Again Brown begs to be born on your tastebuds again and again.

beers.name: Brewer’s Breakfast
beers.description:
Brewed with maple syrup and dried fenugreek seeds, this porter pours with a beautiful lacy and frothy head that carries maple and pecan aromas. When you bring it to your lips a soft sweet hint of maple and the roasted chocolate tones fill the pallet. As the flavor develops you swallow and are left with the slight roast of the chocolate malt and that sweet exhale of maple. Before you pick up the glass for another sip you lick your lips and enjoy another subtle hit of maple. The medium body helps to give you a bit of what you want in a porter and yet light enough to be able to enjoy a few pints.

2013 Bronze Medal Carolina Championship of Beer

beers.name: Dark Construct
beers.description:
Dark was the inspiration to make this stout. A great divine power flowed through our bodies as we mashed this baby in for the first time. This thick bodied sweet stout is great all year long. This beer is the first one we have created after having opening and logging around 100 brews on our little system. We confess it to be our most mature beer as we have had ample time to refine our process.

2013 Bronze Medal Carolina Championship of Beer
2012 Gold Medal Carolina Championship of Beer

beers.name: Forgeworks Smoked Porter
beers.description: Batch #1 on our new 7 barrel brewhouse was named in recognition of the craftsmen who fabricated the system, Bennett Forgeworks in Ridgeway, CO. Brewed using cherry wood smoked malt, this porter is best enjoyed in the company of friends escaping crisp cool weather in front of a fire pit.

beers.name: Forgotten Hollow
beers.description: Brewed with cinnamon, this robust porter is reminiscent of Mexican chocolate with its dark chocolate malty tones. The cinnamon makes this beer the perfect seasonal throughout the harvest-time and holidays.

beers.name: Gizmo Barleywine Style Ale
beers.description: We age our barleywine for a minimum of 3 months prior to serving. This beer has a strong malty toffee flavor with apricot notes. The continuous hopping through the boil gives this beer a smooth hop profile that blends with age.

beers.name: Gizmo Dark Wheat with Rye
beers.description: This is a wonderful dunkelweizen with rich caramel and roasted fruit notes. Brewed with rye gives it a delicious warming spice with just enough alcohol to perk you up, morning or night!

beers.name: Golden Ale-ement
beers.description: Our latest work of art is a cream ale delicately hopped with Tradition and Liberty hops. To achieve the light, sparkling color, we used 90% Pilsen malt and the rest malted wheat for a little body. Crisp and lemony, Golden Ale-ement makes for a tasty session ale at only 4.6%.

beers.name: Know Wonder Pale Ale
beers.description: The latest beer from Gizmo Brew Works waves a fond farewell to summer and welcomes in the fall season. Light in color and body, Know Wonder packs an autumnal crispness that pairs well with a gentle, earthy, fruity flavor and an aroma reminiscent of passion fruit and mango. Brewed and named for the Durham Museum of Life and Science, this delicious pale ale satisfies both the casual craft quaffer and hop heads alike.

beers.name: Raleigh Red
beers.description:
Raleigh Red is the flagship beer for Gizmo Brew Works. This medium bodied amber ale has a distinct crisp, hoppy finish that lets you know what you are drinking but fades away to let you enjoy the sensation time and time again. This is a beer you will be back for.

2013 Bronze Medal Carolina Championship of Beer

beers.name: The Palisade Wasp
beers.description: Gizmo Brew Works’ first IPA offering, derives its name from a song by folk singer Sufjan Stevens and Palisade hops, the main flavor and aroma hop addition in the brew. Bred in the northwest US in Yakima Valley, Palisade hops typically function as complementary hops, but this IPA emphasizes their unique flavor profile. The Palisade Wasp IPA has a strong floral aroma with a hint of tangerine. Its complex flavor imparts apricot, flowers, and an earthy, grassy bitterness, accentuated by a clean, dry finish.

beers.name: Wakup Call
beers.description: Brewed with Larry’s Beans Espresso beans, this porter pours into the glass with a fluffy delicate head. The aroma fills your nose with everything you want in the morning, a nice robust espresso to get your mind on track. As you rub your eyes and bring the glass to your lips the espresso notes breathe life into you. You sip at first, the creaminess of the head hits your lips the roasted Espresso and chocolate notes hit your tongue.. refreshing the mind about… As the flavors come together the medium body and carbonation is just enough to remind you this is a porter and a beer, you open your eyes and realize you have been “sipping” the whole time about the crazy night before.. you have enjoyed yourself almost half the pint.. You pull the glass away and exhale… roasted espresso and chocolate tones drift out… You are ready to tackle your morning.

beers.name: Baird's Forge Imperial Red
beers.description: A massive beast of a red ale, with nutty and toffee malt balanced by huge, juicy American hops, and dry hopped with the tropical Amarillo variety.

beers.name: Das Delikat Berliner Weisse
beers.description: A traditionally kettle-soured, refreshingly tart wheat beer. At our brewpub, try it with a shot of authentic German woodruff syrup, or raspberry for an adult version of a delicious raspberry lemonade!

beers.name: Three Paw Chocolate Hazelnut Porter
beers.description: From our Lost In The Wild series: handcrafted using real Nutella.

beers.name: Vicki the Elephant Peanut Butter Ale
beers.description: This beer has been a runaway hit for our brewery! On September 11, 1955, Vicki, a 6-year-old Indian Elephant, escaped from the Airport Amusement Park in Charlotte. For nine days the fugitive pachyderm roamed free. Following recapture, two years later Vicki was sold to Carowinds developer Pat Hall. Hall relocated/resold the wayward elephant to a little-known town northwest toward the Blue Ridge Mountains, a town named Granite Falls. Vicki, due to an incurable illness, died shortly thereafter in Granada Farms Zoo. In 1976 the zoo was redeveloped into a golf course. Today, Vicki rests under the Number Three fairway — circus elephant bones under a golf course! With the release of our Peanut Butter Ale, GFB celebrates the free spirit in all of us. This specialty ale is reddish in color, slightly sweet with low hop bitterness. Crisp, smooth, and sessionable.

beers.name: Barrel Aged Russian Imperial Stout
beers.description: This Russian Imperial stout was uniquely aged on a variety of select oak barrels.  Napa Valley Zinfandel, KY Bourbon, TN Whiskey, and NC dark rum casks all add to the complexity and balance in this deep black brew.  Notes of roasted malts, warming alcohol, and hops provide a nice balance for the flavors imparted by the oak, leaving you satisfied and ready for your next sip.

beers.name: Death Defying Spring Ale
beers.description: Our Spring Ale contains Styrian Golding hops which produce floral and spicy flavors that perfectly complement that fruity essence imparted by Belgian style yeast. Light in body with a moderate bitterness, this copper colored Belgian style ale is beautiful in its simplicity.

beers.name: El Dorado Dry Hopped Dark Saison
Gin BA Juniper Saison
beers.description: Dry saison with juniper berries added post boil and aged in craft gin barrels for 7 months

beers.name: Happy New Beer
beers.description: Hi-Wire and Asheville Brewing teamed up to brew a beer to ring in the New Year. “Happy New Beer” is a Honey Red Ale made with Riverbend malt, over 50 lbs. of orange blossom honey and a unique malt from Canada that tastes like, you guessed it, honey. With an ABV of 7.6%, Happy New Beer is a malty and aromatic brew hopped with French Aramis hops which impart floral notes that meld deliciously with all the tasty malt and honey. Start 2015 off with a brew worth celebrating!

beers.name: Lion Tamer Red Rye IPA
beers.description: Red with hops and rye – oh my! Aggressively hopped with a healthy blend of citrus- and fruit-forward hops and balanced by the unmistakable bite of rye, allow this brew to tame your thirst.

beers.name: Pulcinella
beers.description: The blend of Napa Valley Zinfandel, Kentucky bourbon & North Carolina dark rum barrels impart big roast & molasses flavors that are paired with notes of chocolate & vanilla to create a huge creamy beer.

beers.name: The Contortionist
beers.description: We hope you enjoy this dark, hoppy beer.  As you experience the earthy and floral hops that give way to a roasted malt profile, The Contortionist will bend your perception of what a Black IPA can be.

beers.name: Uprisin' Hefeweizen
beers.description: A traditional wheat ale with big ester notes of banana – backed by tones of clove and peppercorn. Brewed with 100% NC grown wheat from Riverbend Malt House in Asheville, NC, this beer is sure to become your summer favorite.

beers.name: Volume 1 - Farmhouse Series
beers.description: We would be remise if the first ale in our farmhouse series didn’t pay homage to those who created the style. A traditional saison, this beer utilizes a classic Belgian yeast strain to achieve flavors of black peppercorn and pear. Flaked oats and wheat create body in the light and earthy saison.

beers.name: Zirkusfest
beers.description: This traditional Marzen boasts all the flavors one wants in a rich Oktoberfest lager without all the heavy finish. The use of Munich malt provides upfront biscuity and honey flavors that fade into a dry finish.

beers.name: Belgian Pale Ale
beers.description: Belgian Pale Ale is one of the less-well-known Belgian styles, as it's not as big, boozy, and sexy as many of the Belgian beers that are imported to the US. Our Belgian Pale Ale is malty, bready and easy-drinking , with a dash of Saaz hops for flavor and aroma.

beers.name: Biere de Garde
beers.description: An homage to higher-gravity French farmhouse ales, Biere de Garde roughly translates to “beer for keeping.” Our version reflects the historical realities of this style of farming, when brewers made do with what was on hand. With three types of barley, wheat, rye, and oats, its aroma smacks of apple, pear, almond, and vanilla, with just a hint of lemon rind.

beers.name: Fig Saison Ale
beers.description: Our take on the crisp, flavorful ales brewed by farmers specifically for summer refreshment, the Fig Saison starts with several varieties of wheat, barley, rye, and, of course, figs. With a complex mix of yeast and fruit aromas that perfectly match its higher level of carbonation, the Fig Saison pours a rich red color and finishes dry with a mix of fruit, floral, spice, and subtle fig-ish notes.

beers.name: Imperial Stout
beers.description: Created in the 18th Century by British brewers for the kinda scary Czars of Russia, the Imperial Stout was designed to be dark, strong, and hardy enough to handle the long and perilous voyage across the Baltic Sea. And you do not want to disappoint the Czars of Russia. Our version is made to stand the test of time, too, featuring rich flavors of chocolate, toffee, coffee, currant, and vanilla. Budem zdorovy!

beers.name: India Pale Ale
beers.description: For our IPA, we used the traditional West Coast India Pale Ale as our template, then forgot where we put the template, then created something completely different. It’s a simple, easily enjoyable IPA with a crisp bouquet of lemon citrus, grapefruit rind, and melon. Tangerine and passion fruit dominate the hop flavor, but without the usual overwhelming bitterness.

beers.name: Reserve Ale
beers.description: The result of our finest brewing efforts, the Ponysaurus Réserve is a  Belgian Dark Strong Ale featuring  rich brown malts and Belgian candy syrup made in-house. Flavorful Belgian yeast yields a complex yet elegant set of fruit and floral notes, while the candy syrup ferments almost completely, resulting in a scarily drinkable beer clocking in at just under 10% ABV

beers.name: Scottish Ale
beers.description: Reflecting the Scottish tradition of brewing beer with a small amount of hops so as to avoid unnecessary interaction with British traders (the bastards), our Scottish Ale is a rich, smooth, malt-focused beer that pours incredibly dark. Nutty Marris Otter malt provides deep hits of caramel, coffee, and chocolate in both the aroma and flavor. Like a drinkable kilt for your gullet.

beers.name: Videri Chocolate Stout
beers.description: A collaboration between Ponysaurus and local chocolatier Videri, our Chocolate Stout is designed to mimic the pure simplicity of a bar of dark chocolate. With a simple grain bill and fresh cocoa nibs added directly to the beer for ultimate flavor commingling, the result is a dark, clean beer that tastes more like artisan chocolate than chocolate cake.

beers.name: Weissbier
beers.description: A celebration of traditional German wheat beers, our Weissbier features the classic banana and clove flavors, with the  refreshing tartness and citrus  notes that can only be found when the beer is at its freshest. We serve the beer cloudy on purpose, as the suspended yeast is crucial to its overall impression.

beers.name: 2.5ish Anniversary Ale
beers.description: Bourbon barrel aged golden belgian ale.

beers.name: Brown Ryed Girl
beers.description: Hoppy, Roasty and Smooth. This beer will stay on your mind long after the last taste, like a song of the classic variety which may or may not have inspired this beer.

beers.name: Dos AKs
beers.description: Stout inspired by the Moles of Oaxata, Mexico. Brewed with chocolate, chipotle, poblanos, cinnamon, coriander, and raisins.

beers.name: Head First
beers.description:
Head First Pale ale is beer for any challenge.

Whether you’re back packing the Appalachian Trail or trying to catch a trophy fish 100 miles out at sea.

Head first is golden tan and has a light crisp sweetness and great body without being too heavy. You won’t get bloated after drinking half a beer. This beer has unique hops, but of course you don’t fear this. Most are late addition hops which gives this beer great hop Aroma’s without the bitterness. Take this beer with you as you seek your next challenge and once you find it, get after it . . . Head First.

beers.name: Kitten Snuggles
beers.description: Imperial Farmhouse Ale brewed with Milk Sugar, Fuzzy Apricots, & Cat Nip FlowersShow More

beers.name: Let's Get Tropical
beers.description: THIS IPA IS BREWED WITH EXPERIMENTAL HOPS THAT GIVE FLAVORS OF PINEAPPLE, CITRUS AND LEMONGRASS. WE COUPLE THAT WITH A YEAST THAT HAS A MILD BANANA FLAVOR AND THEN DRY HOP WITH COCONUT. PUT ALL THIS IS YOUR BLENDER AND YOU GET A GREAT TROPICAL IPA.

beers.name: No Shame
beers.description:
Don’t apologize if what you do is right.

And if what you’re doing right is drink good beer, then have No Shame. This beer isn’t the biggest or the hoppiest beer known to mankind, nor will the beer geeks ever age it for a bottle share. But it is good beer, that’s all that matters!

No Shame is a wheat beer. This beer is a great summer beer or a great beer if your summer never ends. Light body with touches of wheat that adds smooth creamy notes with hops that make this a great drinker! Drink this proud . . . There’s No Shame

beers.name: Over the Edge
beers.description:
If You’re Not Living On The Edge, You’re Taking Up Too Much Space

We’ve never been to India and neither has this beer. We believe the American Style has changed what an IPA is. More Hops, more grain, and more flavor. This is an American IPA.

Over the Edge takes a great balance of 5 grains and then ramps it up with West Coast hops that were born in the shadows of the cascades. We use these Hops in 7 different additions to create an adventure from the beginning of the sip all the way to the burp.

This beer has a blood orange color and thick white head. The beer starts with great hop aroma and malty sweetness followed by citrus orange full bodied flavor, finishing with clean piney end and cascade aroma’s. This beer will not only show you what an American IPA is, it will take you Over the Edge!

beers.name: Pre Game
beers.description:
You wake up and that first thought is . . .

Today is going to be a big day.  It may be a tail gate, a pontoon party, a wedding, or it may be getting ready to run with the bulls.

The fact remains you’ve got to get ready for the big day or prepare for a long night. It’s time to Pre-Game.

Pre-Game is a Session Ale, this means this beer has great drinking potential. At 4.5% it beholds all of the craft flavor that you crave, but stays away from being too heavy. This beer is golden in color and low in bitterness.  Hops do come through in a sweet piney aroma that makes the end of every sip sound like . . . Game Time!

beers.name: Raisin The Roof
beers.description:
You wake up and that first thought is . . .

Today is going to be a big day.  It may be a tail gate, a pontoon party, a wedding, or it may be getting ready to run with the bulls.

The fact remains you’ve got to get ready for the big day or prepare for a long night. It’s time to Pre-Game.

Pre-Game is a Session Ale, this means this beer has great drinking potential. At 4.5% it beholds all of the craft flavor that you crave, but stays away from being too heavy. This beer is golden in color and low in bitterness.  Hops do come through in a sweet piney aroma that makes the end of every sip sound like . . . Game Time!

beers.name: Scratch & Sniff
beers.description: This aromatic IPA is made with 7 hop additions. All those hops are thrown in at special timed editions to create flavor, a nose full of goodness, and light bitterness.

beers.name: Silverback
beers.description: This 6.5% ABV stout with 7 grains and all West Coast hops. It has a beautiful, tan head and the malts give create a smooth roasted taste and chocolate notes. It finishes with slight pine and a little more hops than most traditional stouts.

beers.name: Southern HospitaliTEA
beers.description: Amber ale with a hint of southern tea.

beers.name: Tele-Porter
beers.description: Tele-porter is a robust porter with a rich grain bill and dark malts that we brew with cocoa nibs, milk sugar and aromatic coffee roasted by our friends at Notorious Coffee in Marshall, NC  These ingredients give this beer a wonderful nose of coffee and chocolate, a creamy tan head, and rich mocha taste.

beers.name: Dirty Blond Ale
beers.description:
This wonderfully crisp, clean Blonde Ale is for those who enjoy a great beer but just don’t want all the big malt or hop flavor. 
Brewed with American and British style malts, we added a touch of Crystal malt and our light blonde turned a shade dark. Still lightly hopped with that distinctive Cascade Hop, and fermented to have very little residual sugar, this ale is sure to be a favorite when you want that cold, cool one!

A Blonde Ale that is just a bit naughty!

beers.name: Honey Pale Ale
beers.description:
This Flagship Beer of Bear Creek Brews is a Mild English Style Pale Ale
But Brewed with the addition of Orange Blossom Honey!

Enjoy the aroma of fragrant orange blossoms as you enjoy this lightly hopped, full flavored Pale Ale.
We will brew this same beer using fresh Local Honey or Clover Honey. 
Each imparts a distinct aroma and flavor to this easy drinking thirst quencher.

beers.name: Joy's
beers.description:
This wonderfully crisp, clean Blond Ale is for those who enjoy a great beer but just don’t want all the big malt or hop flavor. 
Brewed with American, British style, and German style malts, lightly hopped with that distinctive Cascade Hop and fermented to have very little residual sugar.

This ale is sure to be a favorite when you want that cold, cool one!

beers.name: Red
beers.description:
Our newest beer to fill our six-pack is Red—an Irish Style Ale.

Red is a traditionally styled Irish Ale with a hefty helping of malt, a little taste of roasted barley and some wonderful red color from the crystal malt, classically hopped with Fuggles and Kent Goldings.

You will really enjoy this winter warmer any time of the year.

beers.name: Scotch Ale
beers.description:
Big and Malty, Lots of Malt in this Classic Style Scotch Ale. Lightly Hopped, this Creamy Dark Amber Ale is nice to cozy up to with a good book and a crackling fire.

Be careful though, as this is known in some circles to be a bit “wee heavy” !

beers.name: Wit
beers.description:
A Belgian Style Wheat Beer
Brewed With Fresh Coriander Seed and Bitter Orange Peel

 Mildly Hopped, this light, clean, and crisp unfiltered wheat beer is an easy drinking afternoon thirst quencher.

beers.name: Acerbic Ecstasy IPA
beers.description:
Plowing into his nostrils, the beautiful – pungent aroma forced the glass to his lips and poured the elixir over the 10,000 taste buds covering his tongue. IMMEDIATELY, his upper lip curled and a HUGE SMILE covered his face as the Lupulin sedated any worries and delivered Acerbic Ecstasy.

India Pale Ale specially formulated for your nose & tongue

beers.name: Ares the Pale
beers.description:
ARES was the great Olympian god of war, battle lust, violence, rage and manliness. We believe that his greatest love, next to Aphrodite, was a nice hoppy ale flavored by his Dad, Zeus. This Pale Dude’s pop flavors AWESOME Pale Ale. As you suck down this Ares The Pale, feel the invigoration of Zeus flow through your veins.

Pale Ale – Blessed & Anointed with Zeus

beers.name: Bucket List Blonde
beers.description:
Here’s to the brave at heart, thrill-seekers, rule benders, adrenaline junkies, caution to the wind trailblazers, gotta-do-it individuals that are serious about their bucket list. Enjoy life & drink great beer. This one’s for you.

What’s in your bucket? Make it a blonde!

beers.name: Brüe 32
beers.description: A Pro Bowl creamy pale ale finishing with a refreshing audible

beers.name: Brüe Diamond
beers.description: The double header of hops in this india pale ale is always in need of a relief pitcher

beers.name: Brüe Scarlet
beers.description: Our sultry amber ale with a refreshing balanced flavor

beers.name: Brüenette
beers.description: Our premier craft brown ale with warm overtones of chocolate

beers.name: Bruevarian
beers.description: This smooth bavarian white wheat brue satisfies your summer thirst.

beers.name: Dark Sour
beers.description: A dark sour with a light maltiness and a not too harsh sour bite.

beers.name: Edinbrüe
beers.description: Our unique, frisky scotch ale that packs a “wee-heavy-punch” with a smooth malty taste

beers.name: Pale Brüe Eyes
beers.description: Our crisp, delicious pale ale that finishes  with a desire for more

beers.name: Saison De Brüe
beers.description: A delicious farmhouse ale with the perfect balance of Turkish figs and wildflower honey.

beers.name: Zambrüeni
beers.description: This refreshing craft lager will keep your palette smooth for the whole game

beers.name: French Oak
beers.description: Oak Aged IPA

beers.name: Green Day
beers.description: A one off specialty Lager dyed green for for St. Patrick's Day.

beers.name: The IPA
beers.description: We have taken two renowned American hops and paired them to create a fresh take on the American India Pale Ale:  Cascade and Centennial.  Both hops are continuously added throughout the boil bring a balanced hop profile that is combined with a smooth malt background.  This beer is hoppy enough for the hophead, yet refined enough for the casual drinker.

beers.name: The Kölsch
beers.description: “The Kölsch” pairs the finest ingredients with traditional brewing techniques and our own Dirtbag spin to bring to life and body to a refreshing, citrus infused masterpiece. The Kölsch starts with a pronounced citrus note provided by blood oranges that finishes with a hint of raspberry. A perfect balance of hops and malt that is assertive, but not overpowering, great for enjoying by itself or with a meal.

beers.name: Red Velvet Chocolate Stout
beers.description: Draft Line Brewing’s version of good lovin’ in a glass. Red Velvet Chocolate Cherry Stout is a sweet, dark, viscous pint of “lets go back to my place”. Brewed with plenty of dark, roasty malts, cocoa nibs and cherries, RVCCS sweet talks you with the subtle chocolate flavor of red velvet cake with hints of chocolate covered cherries. Don’t drink this alone, if you know what we mean.

beers.name: RiverSteam
beers.description: This Strong Scotch Ale, also known as a “Wee Heavy”, is one of our favorite brews. RiverSteam Scotch combines rich malty sweetness from the finest Malts of the UK along with “Earthy Aroma” hops. This medium bodied beer goes down easy and leaves no room for doubt. So go ahead and take a Steam down the River and see where it leads you.

beers.name: SinglePath
beers.description: SinglePath IPA is bursting with hoppy flavors and aromas. We combine four different hops in six different additions for this beer creating a banquet of citrus, piney and floral flavors for the pallet. Then we dry hop the beer with another huge dose of hops creating a bouquet that is complex and balanced.

beers.name: Southern Down Mosaic Saison
beers.description: Draft Line Brewing’s Southdown Saison is farmhouse ale hopped with only Mosaic hops and a splash of sweet orange peel. With a special Belgian blended yeast and a dose of rye in the mash, this beer gives you a dash of spicyness to go along with the tropical fruit flavor and nose that the Mosaic hops bring to the table. This is going to be your go-to beer after a long hot day on the farm or after a long hot day of doing nothing.

beers.name: Blind Man's Holiday
beers.description:
What is Greensboro Pale Ale? It’s a brew that hits the sweet spot between Pale Ale and IPA – just like our hometown of Greensboro hits the sweet spot between the coast and the mountains.

We start with Maris Otter and Vienna malts to get a firm, malty backbone with hints of biscuit and grassiness. A blend of six hops including Amarillo, Simcoe and Chinook contributes a satisfying bitterness and an intense aroma of citrus, flowers and fruit, accented by herbal and piney notes.

beers.name: Chanson de Boheme
beers.description: The French yeast strain imparts moderate esters reminiscent of bananas and apricots that linger over refreshingly herbal and spicy hop flavors. A healthy portion of raw wheat helps to balance these flavors with a light and earthy-crisp, biscuity malt character.

beers.name: Cherchez La Femme
beers.description: This blend of ten different malts creates an unsurpassed richness and complexity. We start with a premium Pale Ale base malt that gives a soft, clean maltiness. We add specialty malts like Black Malt, Crystal, Bonlander Munich, and Breiss Special Roast,  layering in the malt flavors – roastiness, caramel, chocolate, and coffee. Flaked barley adds a full body of extraordinary creaminess. The flavor is balanced with the mellow sweetness of milk sugar and a hint of smooth Fuggle hop bitterness. The aroma is malt- forward, with a whisper of herbaceous hops and a touch of mint.

beers.name: The Guilty Party
beers.description: This charmingly drinkable brew is a pleasure to share with friends old and new. Pleasingly full-bodied, it achieves a nice balance of caramelly, nutty, biscuity maltiness, and smooth but assertive bitterness. The premium English and Belgian malt comes through nicely in the nose, along with floral Indie Golding hops, and a wonderful fruitiness from the traditional English yeast.

beers.name: Donna Golden Ale
beers.description: This striking beer is similar to pale ale but brewed with lager and served in colder temperatures.  True to style this is a very balanced beer that is light bodied malt with subdued fruitiness and a noble hop character offering a very light bitterness. Donna Golden Ale is as beautiful as the person it was named for ~ proceeds go to aide charitable donations

beers.name: Good Hops IPA
beers.description: A flavorful red rye amber with a big citric character, moderate bitterness and a balancing malt backbone.

beers.name: Hoppertone Double IPA
beers.description: This beer has 7 hops without pallet overload.  To balance the strong hoppy taste more malt has been added.  Doubling up on the hops and malts, this brew has strong fruity, hoppy notes and deep malty undertones.  Take a West Coast IPA and feed it steroids!

beers.name: Blonde Ale
beers.description: A lighter, slightly sweet ale with low bitterness

beers.name: India Pale Ale
beers.description: A hoppy beer with a citrus aroma.

beers.name: Pale Ale
beers.description: A pale beer with mild hop.

beers.name: Porter
beers.description: A dark, not to heavy beer with hints of coffee and caramel

beers.name: Dockside Blonde Ale
beers.description: The flavor of this American styled Blonde Ale carries itself tall and svelte while maintaining it’s overall looks and wholesome tasting sensation. Five hop additions introduced throughout the brewing process rounds out this beauty for the perfect blend of balanced hop notes.

beers.name: Outboard Amber Ale
beers.description: An excellent malt backbone with roasty hints of caramel propels this full flavored and deep amber-red colored American Ale into the western sunset.

beers.name: Pontoon Pale Ale
beers.description: Time to hit the lake!  We have launched this lip-smacking, wave crashing American Pale Ale with a fresh hop aroma, light bitterness and a beautiful golden hue that is sure to keep your boat afloat.

beers.name: Belgian Wit
beers.description: A back to basics approach for a beer built for refreshment on hot days. This simple beer is made from barley and wheat with orange peel and coriander to complement the mild hop flavors.

beers.name: Inaugural Amber
beers.description: If springtime sunsets had a flavor, this would be it. Clean and dry, our amber ale has dark fruit that builds to a finish of subtle raisin and toasted sweet nuttiness.

beers.name: Inaugural IPA
beers.description: Combining multiple hopping techniques over the course of brewing and fermentation, we bring out the floral, earthy, and spicy qualities of light but complex hops. The Inaugural IPA has a simple but supportive grain bill and a flavorful yeast to bring it all together.

beers.name: Inaugural Pale
beers.description: A classic style given a modern approach by shifting the hops schedule to accentuate the flavor and fullness that Centennial & Cascade contribute. A true “pale ale,” flavors of orange peel and ripe strawberries build on the full-ness of American barley, wheat, and caramel malts.

beers.name: Inaugural Porter
beers.description: Rich, roasty, and black as night - for those that take a darker approach. Our Inaugural Porter plumbs the depths of dark beer with flavors of coffee and molasses with just enough bright hops poking through.

beers.name: Inaugural Session IPA
beers.description: All the strength and sting of an IPA in a low-alcohol package. Barely tipping the scales at just below 4% ABV, this little beer can be enjoyed all day long - if you can handle the bitterness!

beers.name: Slack Pack IPA
beers.description: Slack Pack IPA is your beer for enjoying that last view after you've left behind the baggage of the day. Slack Pack IPA features a full blend of American hops stacked like a cairn on slightly sweet malt.

beers.name: Trail Mate Golden Ale
beers.description: Light, crisp, and refreshing, with a touch of sweetness and just enough bright hoppy bitterness. Classic European hops meet American barley in this popular golden ale.

beers.name: Wesser Evil Porter
beers.description: Rich, roasty, and black as night - for those with a dark side. Our porter plumbs the depths of darkness with flavors of coffee, molasses, and a soft touch of hops. The name is an homage to nearby Wesser Bald – whose ascent is not nearly as evil as neighboring Cheoah Bald.

beers.name: 3333′ Imperial IPA
beers.description: Brewed in the style of a highly hopped West Coast Blaster this imperial IPA knocks you out with fresh hop aroma and keeps you drinking with a balanced medium-bodied malt presence and clean dry finish. Brewed with Amarillo, Cascade and Simcoe hops this beer is not for the faint of heart. Amber in color and bursting with flavor, this beer is a hop lover’s dream!

beers.name: Alpine Meadows Saison
beers.description: Brewed in the tradition of a Belgian/French Farmhouse ale our light and refreshing interpretation of this style melds the perfect blend of spice and tartness. Light in body, yet bold in flavor this easy drinking Belgian style ale is perfect for any occasion. A house blend of chamomile, lavender and orange peel produces an aromatic profile that complements the traditional Belgian easters and rich flavor profile.

beers.name: Compass Rose Amber
beers.description: A classic American style that is well balanced and designed to incorporate numerous layers of malty flavor. Balanced with a touch of American Cascade and Amarillo hops this dark amber ale drinks with a slight sweetness that is perfectly balanced. Highlighting the malt backbone are flavors of bread and biscuit complemented by the perfect touch of classic American hops.

beers.name: Councill's Store Cream Ale
beers.description: A very light-colored, very light bodied ale brewed with a substantial percentage of flaked corn and some sugar to lighten the color and body of the beer.  This is a great beer for those who haven’t yet been introduced to craft beer, and for those who prefer lighter and less heavy beers.  Naturally, this is a very easy-drinking beer.

beers.name: Downtown Nut Brown
beers.description: A classic Northern English Brown Ale that is very easy drinking and perfect for a brisk fall afternoon. Our nut brown has a subdued roasty palate complimented with a touch of hops to balance out the malty, medium bodied roast flavors. With a beautiful medium brown hue this English ale is designed to please the palate during any season.

beers.name: Lost Province IPA
beers.description: This easy-drinking IPA is brewed with Galaxy, Belma, and Chinook hops. This brew exhibits bright citrus, melon and peachy-mango notes in the aroma, with a supporting resin and piney base to the flavor profile. The combination of lingering hop bitterness and high attenuation give this beer a dry finish that invites additional drinking.

beers.name: St. Nick's Reward
beers.description: This beer is a traditional English Old Ale with a touch of citrus and holiday spice. With a rich malty base, noble hops and aromatic spices this beer is best enjoyed by a warm crackling fire.

beers.name: The Golden Ticket Chocolate Porter
beers.description: Collected straight from the chocolate river of Wonka-land this dark, chocolately porter has a touch of sweetness to help balance the distinct malt backbone and subtle roast character. The Golden Ticket is an indulging libation for all to enjoy and don’t worry no Oompa-Loompas were hurt in the brewing of this beer!

beers.name: The Lost Rye-Der
beers.description: Brewed in the American style of a Pale Ale, with an added rye complexity, this beer exhibits an amazing hop aroma featuring both Centennial and Amarillo hops. Bright and citrusy, yet perfectly balanced, this classic pale ale will definitely keep you in the saddle for any adventure!

beers.name: The Tubby Monk
beers.description: Aged for over two months, this Belgian inspired ale is both full bodied and full flavored. Featuring aromatics of wood-fired cherries and dark fruits, with a huge malt backbone, this brew is easy sipping yet packs a punch! No need to be a member of the cloth to enjoy this winter specialty ale!

beers.name: Wildberry Saison
beers.description: Aged for over two months with raspberries and dark cherries this innovative Belgian inspired farmhouse ale is light and crisp with delightful fruit aromatics. Dark purple in color, this easy-drinking saison has a touch of Appalachian character married perfectly with classic Belgian tradition!

beers.name: Bière de Neuse
beers.description: The Saison (translated as “season”) is a drier pale ale known for high attenuation and a spicier yeast strain. Dating back to the 1800’s, the Saison originated in Wallonia, a French speaking region of southern Belgium. Traditionally brewed in the winter months, saisons would age until the summer when they were brought out for the farmhouse workers of the time who were allotted to imbibe up to five liters each workday as a way to combat dehydration when local water supplies were unfit for consumption. Slightly dry and with a hint of citrus, our saison’s complexion is subtle but distinctive and has quickly become one of our favorite session beers.

beers.name: Caleb’s High Noon
beers.description: Caleb’s High Noon, blended to showcase the true form of a West Coast Imperial IPA with our own brand of East Coast craft, engulfs the senses from boil to bottle. An unrepentant outlaw brewed to remind your palate that the high alpha acid Simcoe, Columbus, and Centennial hops are a force to be reckoned with. With a robust, piney flavor this 100+ IBU brute will have you armed and ready to face the  final showdown.

beers.name: La Belge aDorẻe
beers.description: La Belge aDorẻe as written has a double meaning of “The Belgian Adored” (adorẻe) as well as “The Belgian Golden” (Dorẻe). Originally brewed with the intent of compromise between staple European lagers and French wines, the Belgian Golden prides itself in the balance of spice and fruit notes with full-bodied flavor. Our Golden’s delicate flavor profile and deceptively high ABV packs a beguiling but mellow punch perfect for spring afternoons and summer evenings everywhere.

beers.name: Laila’s Midnight
beers.description: In its infancy the Imperial IPA was nothing more than a heftier version of the standard India Pale Ale. The British found that in sending beer to their troops stationed in India they needed to add more hops to act as a preservative. In doing so the added bitterness created a newly sought after flavor profile inevitably leading to the birth of the Imperial IPA. Laila’s Midnight takes the experiment a step further by adding a dash of nutty Midnight malt and a few other inspired hints of roasted malt flavor to produce a well-balanced and mystically vibrant dark IPA.

beers.name: Riverkeeper’s Wit
beers.description: The traditional Belgian Style Wit is distinguished by its prominent notes of coriander and orange peel. The balance of wheat and malts with a minimal addition of hops in our Riverkeeper’s Wit creates a light-style ale that’s easy on the eyes and even easier on the palate. A portion of every Riverkeeper will be donated to help clean and maintain our wonderful Neuse River and its surrounding tributaries.

beers.name: Riviѐre
beers.description: The origin of the Belgian Tripel traces its roots back the Trappist Monastery at Westmalle. Blended with an intricate complexion of moderate fruit esters, our Riviѐre delivers a robust ABV but minimized alcohol flavor. Substantially carbonated, expect a sustained rocky head and the distinct release of fruitiness and plum characters.

beers.name: Black Wolf Smoked Stout
beers.description: Brewed with Beechwood smoked malted barley, this autumnal offering reminds one of good times around a campfire. Earthy, dark, and delicious, come join the circle!

beers.name: Barbieswine
beers.description: Our barley wine is what would be considered an English-style barley wine.  We aged this high gravity beer for 9 months before its release; 60% in Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrels and 40% in stainless steel, blended back together to achieve a balance of complex notes from the liquor barrels, but still preserving the malt flavors that can be lost in the barrel aging process.  We are releasing this offering in kegs, and we will also be doing a limited release of 22 oz bottles, perfect for cellaring.

beers.name: Boarrior IPA
beers.description: A prominent hop bite is balanced by complex malt character. Dry hopped with Warrior hops.

beers.name: Hoofenweizen
beers.description: Dry, hoppy, and unfiltered, this wheat ale is the perfect companion for the spring season.

beers.name: PIg Porker
beers.description: Made in the London style, special malts lend notes of chocolate and caramel to this brown porter.

beers.name: Pigmosa
beers.description: A Russian-style Kvass combined with fresh squeezed orange juice to produce a delightful, refreshing summer ale.

beers.name: Plain Pig
beers.description: This golden colored ale is the Pig Pounder take on an English classic pub ale. Hints of malty caramel and bread are balanced by a very modest hop addition, and complimented by an aroma of sweet fruit and floral notes. The overall light body, and low ABV makes this a highly sessionable English style ale.

beers.name: Punk Pig Ale
beers.description: Pumpkin and spice make a perfect fall compliment to our Plain Pig Ale.

beers.name: Punk Piggy
beers.description: Pumpkin and spice abound in this abbey-style ale. Perfect for the fall season.

beers.name: Belgian Dubbel
beers.description: Complex, mysterious and deceivingly dangerous, our Belgian Dubbel is both easy-drinking and full of character. Inspired by one of our favorite recipes, this beer will keep you guessing with an interplay of flavors: plum, raisin, spice, banana, clove, chocolate, brown sugar, and cherry can all be found in a single tasting!  A hint of earthy spiciness with a sweet lingering caramel tone precedes a pleasantly warm alcoholic finish.  By far our most expensive beer to create, our Dubbel pushes the limits of our mash tun’s capabilities and delivers a beer worthy of the famed Trappist monastery’s that originated the style.

beers.name: Belgian Pilsner
beers.description: Hallmarked by the generous use of the Noble Saaz hop, this Belgian interpretation of a Czech Pilsner is also noted for its rich gold color, fat maltiness and moderate body.

beers.name: Bière De Garde
beers.description: Name literally means, “Beer which has been kept or lagered.” No expense was spared in recreating this traditional artisanal ale from Northern France. To recreate this regional specialty, we imported all of the ingredients from the countries that birthed the style. The end result is a malt-forward amber with deep hints of caramel and candied apple. Eight different specialty malts come together to yield a magnificently complex malt profile. The French Strisselspalt hops used for aroma create a mildly spicy and floral bouquet. The unique yeast strain combined with warm fermentation and an extended cold-conditioning period produce a smooth and drinkable ale reminiscent of a lager but with full flavored ale fruitiness.

beers.name: Identity Crisis
beers.description: A Dry-Hopped Sweet Tart Sour Mash Blonde Ale. This beer was Soured on the hot side with Lactobacillus over a Holiday Weekend then dry-hopped in the fermenter on the cold side with Galaxy and Amarillo.

beers.name: Mocha Java Porter
beers.description: You’ve been patiently waiting, and finally, your fall favorite is back!  The Sugar Creek Mocha Java Porter perfectly embodies the fall season by blending all of the flavors of our rich and easy drinking Porter with a locally sourced, 100% organic, fair trade coffee.  Our beer engineers hand selected the brew and blend using ten of their favorite coffees and a double blind taste test. In this limited taproom-only bottle release, the hops take a back seat by adding some delicate floral notes and our blend of four malts and locally roasted, cold brewed coffee take the spotlight. The end result is an exceptionally smooth and drinkable beer with some mild dark fruit flavors, hints of roasted malt nuttiness and a bittersweet dark chocolate coffee finish.

beers.name: Pale Ale
beers.description: A multicultural fusion combining American and European styles. This ale, brewed with imported Belgian specialty malts supported by a traditional English floor malt backbone, is hopped with some of America’s most popular whole-cone hop varieties yielding a surprisingly refreshing and well-balanced pale ale.  Pronounced flavors of fruit, citrus, pine and grapefruit balance a caramelized toastiness from our unique malt combination appealing to both hop-heads and malt-lovers alike.  Expect a medium-bodied ale with a dry finish that will lend itself to easy drinking any time of year.

beers.name: Porter
beers.description: Deliberately delicious, this beer is the perfect companion to a Fall Carolina day.  Four different malts combine with an understated hop character to produce notes of chocolate, coffee, caramel and a light sweetness which permeates the beer. Like its cousin the stout, the porter is full of rich, roasted malt flavors yet has a lighter body and balanced bitterness which gives this style its wide appeal. Moderately carbonated with a clean and bittersweet finish, this beer goes down smoothly and won’t fill you up, so feel free to have a few.

beers.name: Raspberry White Ale
beers.description: The Sugar Creek Raspberry White Ale is the result of the combination of a watchful eye, like that of a Trappist Monk, with the technical precision of a nuclear engineer.  This traditional 14th Century recipe has been revived by our beer engineers using over 500 pounds of fresh raspberries.  The Sugar Creek Raspberry White Ale is a naturally vibrant ruby pink in color and pours with a picture perfect white head.  The clean, yet subtle, tartness makes this beer the perfect pairing for the Carolina sunshine.

beers.name: Saison
beers.description: A traditional farmhouse ale that dates back to the origin of agriculture in Southern Belgium, this style was brewed by farmers to nourish their seasonal workers – known as Saisonniers –  during the grueling work of the season’s harvest. A fairly strong beer with an ABV of 6.6%, Saison’s were traditionally brewed in the winter strong enough to preserve them for the following year’s harvest but light enough to quench the farmhands’ thirst.  Our rendition of this beer will transport you back in time, where you’ll be greeted with an array of distinctly Belgian flavors.  Notes of spice, clove and banana wonderfully combine in this beer with a light toastiness from its traditional Belgian Malt, completing with a tart and dry refreshing finish.

beers.name: Witbier
beers.description: With a recipe that dates back to the 14th Century, this is one of our most traditional beers. Our interpretation was inspired directly by Pierre Celis and his original efforts to resurrect this beloved style. This beer is an unfiltered Witbier or “White Beer” to the Flemish-speaking Belgians because of its opaque, white appearance. It measures 4.4% ABV and is a wonderfully refreshing, easy drinking beer enjoyed throughout the year. Its grain bill includes nearly 50% unmalted wheat and oats while it is very lightly spiced with Coriander, Orange Peel, and a touch of other unique flavors. The yeast in this recipe was cultured from the original strain near the town of Hoegaarden in Belgium and adds a pleasant fruitiness during fermentation. Enjoy this beer with or without an orange slice. Although the beer connoisseur might frown at you, we won’t judge you if you ask for one.

beers.name: Honey Porter
beers.description: The name is self explanatory. Using honey mellows the sometimes-overbearing roasted malt notes characteristic of porters, a big reason people do not generally like this style of beer. This beer was initially slated to be a seasonal beer, but a certain Kevin would have none of that.

beers.name: Sweet Memories
beers.description: Slight initial flavor of roasted oatmeal with a smooth chocolate finish. A beautifully clear dark red-brown that is easy to drink.

beers.name: Lollygagger
beers.description: A sparkling blonde ale with subdued maltiness and unobtrusive hoppiness, this German style pale ale is perfect for Lollygagging in the park for nine innings on a hot summer day.

beers.name: Water Tower Wheat
beers.description: Amber in color, our “leichte weisse” is a subtle German style wheat beer made for sweltering double headers during the Dog Days of summer.

beers.name: Potter's Clay
beers.description: The potter is an artist and an artisan – skillfully looking for beauty in the shapeless red clay. We pay respect to the potter and his clay through our Potter’s Clay Amber Ale. It’s sweet crystal and robust Munich specialty grains represent the artist’s fulfillment of well-crafted pottery. The Cascade and Fuggle hops add a slight bittering effect likened to the artisan’s acceptance of starting again. May the artist and artisan be forever linked, appreciated, and respected.

beers.name: Abbie Was Stout
beers.description: An 11.5% Russian Imperial Stout conditioned and barrel-aged for almost a full year before being bottled in a very limited run of 36 bottles

beers.name: Cardinal Gin Barrel Aged Philosopher's Wit
beers.description: Imperial Belgian Wit aged in Cardinal Gin Barrels for 1 year.

beers.name: Eat My Dust
beers.description: New England Style Double IPA brewed with Barley, Wheat and Oats. Dry-Hopped at 3.5lbs per barrel with Simcoe and Mosaic!

beers.name: Lily Bean Golden Stout
beers.description: Infused with Cocoa Nibs, Vanilla Bean, & Lily Bean Coffee Extract

beers.name: Scruggsdiddlyumptious
beers.description: Brett IPA with Mandarina Bavaria & Citra Amarillo hops. Citrus bomb!

beers.name: HBC 344 Single Hop IPA
beers.description: An IPA brewed with a single, experimental variety of hop, HBC 344, a hop described as "Juicy Fruit/Jolly Rancher with notes of eucalyptus and herbal tea".

beers.name: Lunsford Robust Porter
beers.description: A base of roasted malts gives this beer its characteristic coffee and chocolate flavors, which are matched by a pleasantly assertive bitterness.

beers.name: Preyer American Wheat Ale
beers.description: A light bodied, crisp beer with a wheaty bloom, finishes with a subtle hop flavor.

beers.name: Red Shed Red IPA
beers.description: An aroma of pine, with a hint of melon, gives way to the body of this chewy, caramely IPA. Finishes with a punch of juicy, citrusy hop flavors.

beers.name: Rye-ku Rye Pale Ale
beers.description: Twenty percent rye, made with Rakau hops--a nontraditional take on the traditional American Pale Ale. Dry and sharp, with a hint of malty biscuitness.

beers.name: Vladibeer Russian Imperial Stout
beers.description: A Russian Imperial Stout brewed with flaked oats. Full bodied and heavy roast flavor.

beers.name: Godless Killing Machine
beers.description: This big, bold stout proudly features loads of caramel and roasted malts. With a balance of dark fruits, rich chocolate, and roasty coffe, be careful, this one is a sipper.

beers.name: Law and Porter
beers.description: This beer is loaded with malty notes of caramel and chocolate. All the great flavor and body of a much bigger beer are packed into this delicious nitro porter.

beers.name: Mocha Good Morning Vietnam
beers.description: Coffee vanilla blonde ale with locally roasted beans with an addition of locally roasted cacao nibs. Served on nitrogen for a soft creamy feel.

beers.name: Peachy Apribot
beers.description: This golden sour ale is brewed with local NC malts and fermented in our oak foeder. It is then re-fermented with peaches and apricots to create a tart, dry beer bursting with the aroma of succulent stone fruits.

beers.name: T-Rex Arms
beers.description: This classic German-style Gose is the product of a mixed fermentation resulting in a dry, tart character that is then spiced with salt and coriander.

beers.name: The Legendary Roots Brew Ginger Saison
What He's Having
beers.description: The ninth batch in our rotating IPA series.  The malt and hops will vary with each batch, but you can always count on a dry beer with a bright, hoppy flavor and aroma.  Batch 9 features Simcoe and Lemon drop hops with honey malt, resulting in a juicy, tropical West Coast take on the style.

beers.name: What I'm Having
beers.description: All the juicy hop flavor you crave with less of the intoxicating qualities of it’s big brother.  What I’m Having is generously dry hopped with Amarillo and Citra for a citrusy, tropical hop flavor.

beers.name: Willie Saison
beers.description: Our head brewer, Dan, named Wooden Robot’s brew dog, Willamette, after one of his favorite American hop varieties. He goes by the nickname Willie, and so does our crisp, refreshing saison, which blends a generous dose of Willamette hops, with our dry, fruity, and spicy saison yeast. Brewed with 100% NC malted barley, Warrior® and Willamette hops, and our house saison yeast.

beers.name: Fall Amber with Roasted Pecans
beers.description: A malty rich amber ale brewed with Cascade and Amarillo hops. Hand-roasted Pecans are added after primary fermentation in this creation.

beers.name: Grapefruit IPA
beers.description: The Blue Ghost IPA with a fresh-squeezed blend of white and pink grapefruits added late in secondary, adding to the tropical and citrus punch that the IPA begins with as a result of the hops that go into the brew.

beers.name: Heaven Hill Bourbon Barrel-Aged Imperial Stout
beers.description: Barrel aged for 5 months beginning in April of 2016, this Imperial Stout has an amazing nose and flavor of dark chocolate, coffee, caramel, dark fruits, vanilla and bourbon. And it's very smooooth.

beers.name: IPA
beers.description: A simple malt bill consisting of Pale, Vienna, Munich and Crystal 10. Enjoy the hoppiness of this beer, dry-hopped with Cascade, Centennial, Mosaic and Chinook

beers.name: Kolsch
beers.description: The German version of a Pale Ale, this brew is straw yellow in color, light, crisp and refreshing.

beers.name: No Noggin Pumpkinhead Ghostman Ale
beers.description: 8 different malts, highlighted by Special B, Honey, and Smoked malt went into creating this strong ale.Pumpkin was added during fermentation as well as a pint of pumpkin pie spice in secondary.

beers.name: Pale Ale
beers.description: Pale, Crystal 40, Aromatic Munich, Melanoidin and Oats compose the grain bill. Lots of Cascade and Centennial hops were added to this one throughout the brew.

beers.name: Stout
beers.description: A quaffable, malty, drier stout highlighted by Crystal 120, Roasted, Chocolate malts and flaked oats.

beers.name: Yard Breather
beers.description: An East Coast style IPA brewed with Columbus, Galaxy, and Mosaic hops.
